review.itemreviewed: Bahia 2/1mm Front Zip Short-Sleeve Springsuit - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've lived in Maine for 30 years, and getting in the ocean has always bordered on painful! A standard wetsuit helps, but isn't very convenient for the quick, fun beach dunk or casual boogie board session. This suit makes that transition from the warm sand to the icy water so much more seamless! Extra perk: looks great! (I'm 68, 5'5", 108 lbs.)
review.name: Perfect for swimming in the Maine ocean!

description: Buy the Carve Designs Roley Cowl Neck Pullover Sweatshirt - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Roley Cowl Neck Pullover Sweatshirt - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Carve Designs Roley Cowl Neck Pullover Sweatshirt - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Roley Cowl Neck Pullover Sweatshirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: Super cozy fabric, and I like the drawstring so you can wear long like a tunic or shorter like a regular sweatshirt. The color is a little more pale than I was expecting, not my favorite but it’s ok. The think I don’t like is the collar. Other reviews said the same thing and I should have listened. So I’m going to try my hand at changing the style of the collar somehow so I like it better. It’s too stiff and bulky to drape well so it just looks a bit odd. Maybe it’s just this color? But I got in on a great sale and it’s not returnable because of that, so no big deal. It’s so cozy that at worst, I’ll just wear at home or camping or for chores if I can’t make it look how I want. I may have even sized up to make it more oversized, but this does fit well as-is.
review.name: Super soft and cozy material

review.itemreviewed: Roley Cowl Neck Pullover Sweatshirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: I thought these cowls would be so cute - one they're rather large and two - the neck design (a design flaw?) is unlike any I've seen before. When you put it on it looks like something out of a spacesuit neckline - sticks out in a flute on both sides and it's so bulky you can mash it down or otherwise adjust. To be honest, I can't even cut apart and reassemble - IT'S THAT BAD! I'll be sending all three back.
review.name: What a weird neck design!

review.itemreviewed: Roley Cowl Neck Pullover Sweatshirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: Beautiful color. I tried it on. the outside shirt is so soft  inside shirt fabric isn't fleece, it feels the fabric was braid from  dried grass.  Maybe its just my skin. This is not for me.
review.name: Inside shirt  fabric differ

name: Roley Cowl Neck Pullover Sweatshirt - Women's

review.reviewBody: I’m really happy with the fit and comfort of these Fizik Terra Atlas shoes. Finally found a pair that fits normal. And they look great too!!
review.name: Super comfortable

review.reviewBody: I have a couple of hundred miles in these shoes. The fit is good. One of the studs fell out of the shoe on the first ride and Fizik customer service never responded about a request for replacement. Note that the boa dials on the shoes do not loosen (multi-directional), they either open or tighten, which may be a deal breaker for those that like to loosen while riding.
review.name: Fizik Terra Atlas

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable
review.name: Great shoe.

review.reviewBody:
This replaced the Terra X5 shoe. It is almost identical except for the removal of the lower strap. This was not something that should have been removed. 

I can tighten the top of the shoe, but now my toes and lower end of my foot are way too loose while riding. Tightening the BOA more just tightens the top and does nothing for the toe end. 

After trying these out I found a like-new used pair of Terra X5 on eBay thankfully and am back on the shoes I love. 

Since I can't return these due to taking a muddy mtb ride, I will keep them as backups for muddy race weekends.
review.name: Not nearly as good as its predecessor

name: Terra Atlas Mountain Bike Shoe

description: Buy the DAKINE Session 8L Bike Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Session 8L Bike Hydration Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the DAKINE Session 8L Bike Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Session 8L Bike Hydration Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the DAKINE Session 8L Bike Hydration Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a bike hydration pack that would replace my beloved but well-travelled and used Osprey Viper 10. 
The Viper 10 was an excellently designed compact yet loaded bike hydration backpack.
It perfectly suited me.
Loved the fit.
Unfortunately, it has been more than 10 years since I purchased the Viper 10, and Osprey has discontinued the model.
The DAKINE Session 8's bladder is a little smaller, but the bag is almost the same as the Viper 10.
I immediately fell in love with it.
Beautiful design, very comfortable, well made, and packed with features that suited my purpose.
Love the camo look.
If you are looking for a hydration pack, that is light and comfortable, the DAKINE Session 8 is worth the look.
To capped it all, I got it 50% off!!!
review.name: Outstanding hydration pack!!

review.reviewBody: I was searching for a hydration backpack and this Dakine got my attention, decided to go for it and it was a great decision. The material and construction is top notch, the pockets gave me the chance to carry more than I think could carry. Pockets for your phone, tools, keys, a pocket air pump etc. Even though it is not too big, I have other hydration backpacks and comparing with those the size is very similar. The capacity is superb, I was looking for that feature, the chance to carry close to 2L of liquid on longer rides. Easy to clean. Very happy.
review.name: Love it!

name: Session 8L Bike Hydration Backpack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Icebreaker Hike Pants - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are a great pair of hiking pants, lovely fabric and well made. The only problem was they didn't fit me - too tight in the waist. I used the size calculator and it recommended a 29, which was probably the right size, the cut just didn't work. I think a larger size would have just been too baggy, even if better in the waist.
review.name: Really nice pants but didn't fit me

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these for the higher waist, better with a backpack on. These are so comfy I wear them everywhere. I love the natural fabric, too.
review.name: Excellent hiking pant

review.reviewBody: The fabric on these is very thin and tight-knit, and high quality. No stretch so you'll want them baggier than stretch pants. I recommend sizing down; I'm usually a 28 but I could have gone with a 27 or even 26. Women may also want to try the men's version for a different cut; these sit slightly higher and have a *lot* of room in the butt. Unfortunately the white color is a bit see through and doesn't work for me at all; recommend the loden. The size 28 worked for my partner who would typically be a size 29, and the inseam for her 33" inseam was only an inch short and workable. Would be better without the logo and also the pesky zipper pulls bouncing on the large pockets. If Icebreaker made a work version (no logo, straight leg, pleated front, no hiking pockets, no knee articulation, yes gusset, yes double snap closure or side closure) from the same fabric, that would be fantastic.
review.name: White Color Does Not Work, Size Down. Make a work version!

name: Hike Pants - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Innox Pro GTX Mid Jr Hiking Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody:
The Innox pro is a great shoe for kids and adults alike!  I have an adult pair and love them, and the cool thing about Lowa is that they do not "de-tune" kids products;  they are build as solidly as the adults boots are.  Pretty incredible!  My son loves these and gets him excited about being outside.
The sizing was translated from the Lowa European sizing, and is close, but runs a little large.  Maybe go 1/2 size down and you will be set!
review.name: My kiddo asks to wear these!

review.itemreviewed: Innox Pro GTX Mid Jr Hiking Boot - Kids'
review.reviewBody: I still cannot understand how a 5 was more than 1 inch too large for my adult feet, I have never had this size measure so large.

description: Buy the MSR HyperFlow Microfilter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: HyperFlow Microfilter
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR HyperFlow Microfilter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Hint: when the chamber fills with water, there is always some air in it. Only push to pump water out until just before the air, ie: do not push bubble of air thru. So I tip the filter down toward the bottle and it works well. The filter does not like pumping air. This works well.
review.name: Hint for pumping

review.reviewBody: While I was pumping this filter came apart in my hands! If I was alone, I would have been left without water!! Would not rely on this alone. I am buying a squeeze-type filter from now on. Less moving parts that could break, and way more compact! Very disappointed in what I thought was a top of the line brand. Hoping that MSR will make things right and stand behind their product...
review.name: Broke in the Backcountry!!

review.reviewBody: Never worry about water again with this ultralight marvel!
review.name: The future of H2O

review.reviewBody: I've had one of these filters since it's release, several years now. It's been my go to on backpacking trips, thru-hikes and backcountry hunting trips all over the western United States. I've supported multiple people in all of these scenarios with a single filter. I may have backwashed it a handful of times and still using all original parts... Just ordered a replacement filter and maintenance kit to ensure that it remains my go to for years to come.
review.name: Years of reliability

review.reviewBody:
I have had this pump for approximately three years. It is only used for a week every summer. I have had a plastics part break twice. First time the pump was still usable, but had to be held by two people to operate. Second break was the clear plastic in the bottle fill lid fitting. The resulted in the pump being nonfunctional. It appears that the plastic parts are not strong enough to withstand use over time. The fatigue and then break. 

I received a repair part for the first break. Based on the repeated issue I think that I will be looking at other models. Additionally, the on line repair site states that it will be 12 weeks before I get a response. Also, I was unable to upload pictures of the damage (jpg files).
review.name: Does not stand up over time

review.reviewBody:
I love this thing.  I've had mine for years and service it annually.  I'll take this mountain biking, hiking, and even backpacking.  The filter comes with an attachment for a Nalgene bottle, but it even fits some bike bottles as well, so that you can clip in and pump with out risking spilling that water you worked so hard for.  I've also found you can pop the bite valve off of a bladder and plug the hose into the filter so you can easily refill a hydration bladder.

The only caveat is you'll want to keep it in your sleeping bag on cold nights in the backcountry to help prevent the filter from freezing up.
review.name: Best overall filter

review.reviewBody: I have used approximately 6 different filters from 3 manufacturers. This one is the one I have been using exclusively for the past 8 years.
review.name: Impressions after extensive 8 years of use

review.reviewBody: At 55 years old and still hiking the mountains, light weight and durability is the key to keep on moving for me. This has been great for my multi day hikes across the Enchantments, WA.
review.name: Lightweight

review.reviewBody: Love this pump so much I bought a second one. I got tired of swapping bag to bag and now I always have one on me no matter what trip I am going on. Such a simple, fast and effective way to collect drinking water in the backcountry.
review.name: Just get one, you won't regret it.

review.reviewBody: I was so excited, I thought I had found the filter for me after trying it out at home. Even following the guidelines for back flushing and in what was very clear and clean water the filter clogged. Total let down. Im ok with spending money on a reliable item for use in backcountry hunting. This is not it. MSR advertises themself as making reliable products....""Safety"" is in the name and by this filter making past RnD and for sale makes me change my view of this company which prior to this filter I have been very loyal. Do not buy!
review.name: Not reliable!!!

name: HyperFlow Microfilter

review.itemreviewed: Silver Ridge Utility Lite Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Bought this shirt because I was a fan of the original lightweight nylon Silver Ridge shirts, which I could wear for days without them starting to smell.

On top of the new polyester version breaking down/tearing easier, I found that new version also worsens sweat odor, due to the stretch fabric trapping sweat/bacteria.

Please bring back the original nylon version, please!!

Silver Ridge Utility Lite Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I picked one of these up at a 3rd party retailer after having looked for months and months, particularly to replace one that I had worn for years. I got so much use and utility out of the old one that it was a no-brainer to replace it. As I had hoped, same quality and fairly accurate fit/sizing. Whether it has longevity is yet to be seen. I was super excited particularly because it did NOT have PFG printed all over it! (Seriously, why is it so hard to find these shirts in stores without having the PFG logos on them? Not everyone is into fishing...)
review.name: Omni-Shade shirt? With no PFG logos?! Yes, please!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] While looking for a small backpack for my Olympus M43 camera and multiple lenses, the PRVKE 21L bag with camera cube kept coming up in reviews as a great choice. I appreciate that it has both a well padded and highly configurable section for my camera equipment and a large open free space for less sensitive gear. Also, the ability to attach my tripod to the pack really simplifies preparations and hiking. The water resistant materials and well sealed closures are important features to me and have proved their value in just a short time while out in the winter weather. I'm already planning my next purchase of a PRVKE 31L for my larger camera and lenses.
review.name: Great Small Camera Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this as a gift for my son. The bag is amazing with compartments for lens & gear. Best of all, bag can handle rain or snow. Really easy to handle & load. By far best camera bag.
review.name: Great Bag for Camera Gear

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this backpack, the size is perfect and the placement of all the pockets is perfect except the front one, which is hard to open when you have the equally awesome tech bag dangling from it. Still ( stars though
review.name: Fantastic backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My son did a ton of comparison research on backpacks and chose this one for his Christmas present. He absolutely loves it and the rest of us do too! Now we each want one. Super cool style and such a specifically engineered, intentional design!! Impressive!
review.name: Love this backpack!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My son asked for this backpack for his photo equipment - it is very well made and heavy duty! Very happy with this purchase
review.name: Backpack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Full disclosure, my Gen 1 Prvke broke at the zipper after 4 years of heavy use and travel. Wandrd's lifetime warranty is legit - darn you all! The Gen2 Prvke is improved upon and feels even better.
review.name: V2 even better

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is a game changer, it met every expectation that I had for it. It’s very comfortable for my back, very snug feel. When I’m out in public doing shoots I always get compliments. The compartment are easy to adjust with the interchangeable Velcro padding. 10/10 !
review.name: Bag quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loving the bag, very comfortable and able to hold all my camera equipment during my trips.
review.name: Great bag!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Wandrd PRVKE series has established itself as a favorite among photographers, travelers, and creatives for its combination of rugged durability, thoughtful design, and stylish aesthetics. The **31-liter PRVKE Backpack** paired with the **Pro Camera Cube** elevates this bag into an excellent choice for those seeking a versatile, camera-focused bag with ample storage and organizational options.---#### **Build Quality and Design**The PRVKE 31L is crafted from **weather-resistant tarpaulin and ballistic nylon**, ensuring durability and protection against the elements. The bag exudes a modern, minimalist aesthetic that appeals to urban explorers and outdoor adventurers alike. Key design elements include:- **Magnetic Tote Handles:** For quick grab-and-go functionality.- **Weatherproof Zippers:** Offer additional protection for gear in inclement weather.- **Expandable Roll Top:** Adds up to 5 liters of extra storage, taking the capacity to 36 liters.The **build quality is outstanding**, with reinforced stitching and robust materials that can handle heavy loads without showing signs of wear.---#### **Comfort and Fit**The PRVKE 31L offers a comfortable carrying experience thanks to its **padded shoulder straps and back panel**. The bag includes an adjustable chest strap, which helps distribute weight evenly. However, users carrying heavy loads for extended periods may notice the absence of a hip belt, which could alleviate pressure on the shoulders.---#### **Storage and Organization**This backpack is incredibly well-organized, catering specifically to photographers and content creators:1. **Pro Camera Cube**: - The Pro Camera Cube is tailored to fit snugly within the main compartment of the PRVKE, providing padded and customizable dividers for gear. - It easily accommodates a **full-frame DSLR or mirrorless camera, along with 3–4 lenses** and additional accessories. - The cube is removable, allowing the bag to transition seamlessly between a photography bag and a regular travel bag.2. **Dedicated Laptop Sleeve**: - Fits laptops up to 16 inches, with padding for protection. - Also includes a tablet sleeve for added utility.3. **Quick-Access Side Pocket**: - Enables fast retrieval of the camera without fully opening the bag.4. **Expandable Roll Top**: - Great for carrying extra clothing or gear for longer trips.5. **Multiple External Pockets**: - Zippered front pockets for small items. - A hidden passport pocket for secure storage of valuables.---#### **Functionality for Photographers**Photographers will appreciate the **side camera access**, allowing quick and discreet access to their camera. The inclusion of the **Pro Camera Cube** ensures gear stays protected and organized. There are attachment points for tripods, and the roll-top design makes it easy to expand storage when carrying additional items like jackets or food.---#### **Versatility**The PRVKE 31L shines as a **multifunctional bag**, transitioning effortlessly from a camera bag to a general-use travel bag. By removing the camera cube, the main compartment transforms into a spacious cavity suitable for clothes, books, or groceries.---#### **Cons**While the PRVKE 31L with the Pro Camera Cube is an excellent option, there are some minor drawbacks:- **Lack of Hip Belt:** Carrying heavy gear over long periods could be more comfortable with a dedicated hip belt.- **Weight:** At 3.4 lbs (1.5 kg) without gear, the bag is on the heavier side due to its durable materials.- **Limited External Accessory Straps:** While there are attachment points, more robust strap options for larger items would be helpful.---#### **Price and Value**At a premium price point, the PRVKE 31L with the Pro Camera Cube offers excellent value for photographers who prioritize durability, organization, and style. While there are cheaper options, few can match the quality and versatility of this bag.---#### **Conclusion**The Wandrd PRVKE 31L with the Pro Camera Cube is a **top-tier backpack** for photographers and travelers seeking a stylish, durable, and functional solution. Its ability to adapt between camera and travel modes, combined with its weatherproof construction and thoughtful design, makes it a standout option. Despite minor drawbacks, it remains a worthwhile investment for those serious about protecting and organizing their gear.**Rating: 9/10** **Best For:** Photographers, urban explorers, and travelers needing a versatile and durable backpack.
review.name: Review of the Wandrd 31 Liter PRVKE with Pro Camera Cube

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My daughter has the smaller version of this one. I purchased this one recently (for my husband) for Christmas. He absolutely loves it!
review.name: 41 Liter

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots at the end of May for backpacking in the Sierra. They fit my feet right out of the box but when laced the hooks at the ankle of both boots exert pressure that leads to pain. I wore them around the house to test before hiking in them but never felt the hooks. On the first hike the pressure turned to pain in about 3 miles. I've tried numerous combinations of loose lace, tight lace, skip a hook lace but nothing helped. I tried sock combinations with heavy socks, light socks, hiking socks combined with liner socks, nothing worked. I wanted to like these boots because I love the Altra Lone Peak running shoes but I can't recommend them.
review.name: I Don't Recommend

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The shoe was true to size for me, no issues there. relatively water resistant. I wore the shoes for just shy of 2 months and the laces from one shoe caught the loop retainer of the other and tore it off. Apparently under their warranty it counts as normal wear and tear, no help from customer service. Just for your awareness. I wouldn't buy these again.
review.name: I would not recommend this shoe

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've been walking around the Isle of Arran in these boots, which I bought specially for this trip. These boots fit my feet wonderfully. They have great traction. They are a joy, except for one thing. They aren't waterproof. Today, I had to walk through very wet grass. Within 10 seconds, my toes were wet. Within one minute, my feet were making squelching noises. I walked 11 more miles in totally wet boots. This was the 2nd time they got wet through the fabric of the boot (not deep water up by the laces). The first time it took two days to dry and I ended up walking in my running shoes. They got wet too, but they aren't supposed to be waterproof. I love the lone peak running shoes, and I would love these hikers in a dry place, but I am not loving them in Scotland. I really needed waterproof boots and these aren't it.
review.name: Not waterproof, not even a little

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Been wearing these boots for over a year, from light trail walks to hiking the Northeast and UT/AZ. My feet and ankles feel incredibly secure when wearing these. I'd recommend for anything < 8mi.
review.name: Fantastic fit, versatile boot.

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I got to hike up Mount LeConte here in the smoky Mountians with these Lone Peak WP- very nice trip. The Lone Peaks were fun. Light, nimble, wish I had these my whole life. the tongue kept out debris well. Mine have held up well for a year now, mostly very light hikes and day hikes. I'd love to see a cleaner look- like some of your new shoes with the logo set back toward the heel- but they feel great. Sometimes, like all mid boots, i have to mess with t he tongue gusset to get it to sit right and not press on top of my foot. I didn't buy the previous version because the fabric made a popping sound as it creased and uncreased with every step- I couldn't handle it- but these didn't do that so I gave it a go and I think it's a great product, thanks.
review.name: most comfotable hikers ever

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought the same size as my previous lone peak and this model is too narrow. cuts across top and side of my foot when I walk (the area at knuckles of my toes / the beginning of the laces). That's the worst spot to be tight. Was about to take them for my first hike but they would cause pain in no time. Very disappointed.
review.name: Too small

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: tl:dr Not foot shape anymore. Not Wide enough, Mid foot is tight. Spill over the sides. Material is different and feels thin/cheap, and not waterproof. Blue color were bigger in size than the Black. I have been a long time Atra fan and this shoe has changed for the worse. My love letter is for the the Lone Peak 4s as they were the best hiking shoes ever (R.I.P). I had 4 pairs. Each iteration of the Lone Peaks since has been getting worse. Please bring back the original foot shape, gaiter clips, original waterproof material, and stone guard.
review.name: Stay Away - Not Foot Shape Anymore

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Unfortunately, they leak in damp conditions. So, if you plan to hike in rain or snow, I would choose a different product. I've had these for about two years, and I've used them very little. They still have plenty of tread and life left but leak even in light dew on the ground in the morning.
review.name: I would not buy these.

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought two pairs of these in the spring of 2023... used one pair used for training for the Portuguese Camino in September '23' and used the other pair (after break in) for the actual Camino walk. Walked over 400 miles using the same pair in one month and absolutely loved the boot. Never had any type of failure and the boot performed flawlessly. The boot is light weight, supportive and very comfortable. The terrain was varied but only rugged like back country Rocky Mountains in a few spots. The shoe adequately handled cobblestone streets too but there were times when I wished the sole had been a little stiffer. I normally wear a size 13 but bought 14 and they were just right. Love this boot...will buy again and would recommend for anyone contemplating distance walking.
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.itemreviewed: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots for a short winter trip to Colorado in January. I continued to use them daily when I returned home to the midwest and was very happy with the fit, look, and feel of the boots. However, by March the surface fabric of the uppers began to form holes in several different places where the front of the foot flexes. it is very noticeable and I would expect complete failure of the upper soon. It is a shame that poor quality material is ruining an otherwise great shoe.
review.name: Uppers began falling apart in less than 2 months

name: Lone Peak All-Weather Mid 2 Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The 8 oz food jar is just perfect for my husband to take his daily oatmeal with him in the morning. Having said that, it doesn’t keep it as hot as prepared for more than about 3 hours which works for him. It’s good up to about 3 hours, after that it’s just warm, not hot.
We do love the screw on top and the silicone type outer covering.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best little leftover food jar ever. I like the size for taking a small portion of food for my 15 minute break at work. I usually put my leftover veggies or noodles in it. I warm the food up before I put it in the jar and it’s still hot when I take my break, which is usually 3 hours later. Love love love it.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My kids are psyched to be able to bring hot foods to school, opening a whole new set of school lunch options. Soup, Mac and cheese, etc all now possible.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This item doesn’t stay hot, my food gets cold after 2 to 3 hrs I was expecting atleast 6 hrs to stay hot or warm but got disappointed.
review.name: This item doesn’t stay hot,

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Soup, chili, a cold dip or hot/cold tea. The 8 oz Food Jar is just right to toss in a bag or backpack. No spills or leaks. Love it
review.name: Perfect!

description: Buy the Helinox Beach Chair online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Beach Chair
hasVariant.description: Buy the Helinox Beach Chair online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Think sitting in a reclining position and your butt a few inches above the sand and then you need to get up.  So your legs extend out in front so you need to put your heels up against the chair and rock and pull forward simultaneously.  That’s this chair:  My one big question is why would they use steel rivets when the entire point of a “beach chair” is to resist salt water rusting.  Who are the genius product engineers that missed the one singular, crucial design use case: “How to make an indestructible beach chair”.  And replaced it with: “How to make the most awkward chair to get out of”.  Well done PE’s!  Well done”
review.name: Low-low-low-low-low

name: Beach Chair

description: Buy the SRAM Crank Arm Boots online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Crank Arm Boots
hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM Crank Arm Boots online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Product is fine and fits my X01 cranks acceptably.  However, I'm not using this product b/c I essentially destroyed them attempting to use them with my RF Atlas pedals.  These pedals have rather bearing bodies, which exceed the size of the hole of the crank boot.  I attempted to enlarge the hole myself (without the most appropriate tool) - which resulted in the untimely demise of the crank boots.  TLDR: large bearing pedals are not going to fit.
review.name: Fine, But Usability Depends on Pedals

review.reviewBody: Running a 2021 version of the X01 and these boots slide up and down with my XT clips installed. Terrible fit. I've had much better luck with older versions of the Race Face boots. Probably need more variations of these boots if the crank arms are going to be different widths from year to year.
review.name: Sloppy Fit

review.reviewBody: These fit excellent on my GX cranks and have held up to a few rock strikes already. I purchased a new bike and wanted to keep my cranks looking and working great as long as I can. So far so good.
review.name: Fitment and quality

review.reviewBody:
Sure seems like they have put the big hole on the wrong side, the contour of the boot does not line up with the contour of my x01 crank arms. Fits better reversed but then the holes don’t line up and you can’t put on your pedals. 

They will do the job, but for a branded product, pretty piss poor execution. 

Would not buy again.
review.name: Poor fit, wonky back hole placement

name: Crank Arm Boots

description: Buy the Gregory 3D Hydro Trek 3L online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 3D Hydro Trek 3L
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory 3D Hydro Trek 3L online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is very nice functionality for backpacking, though I don't know that having all the water weight at the top of my bag is necessarily worth the convenience. Jury's out on that one. And I like the 3-d design to hold the sides of the bag away from each other for drying, but somehow it still dries incredibly slow, like slower than my other reservoirs that don't have this function. Overall, I'm glad I purchased and tried it out, though I don't know that it will end up being my long-term go-to.
review.name: Good functionality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Everybody's got a bladder out there and I've spent some time with a few. After several day trips and backcountry trips with this one, I really like it. It rides a bit higher in my pack than the longer ones and can fit right on top of my fully loaded-pack. I had no problems with leaking of any kind. The bite valve is great and the Basecamp Tap is pretty nice for filling up my pot to boil water. The handle makes filling from a larger water jug or a spigot easy.  If you're in the market for a new bladder I highly recommend this Hydro Trek from Gregory. It will continue to live in my pack.
review.name: Pretty sweet baldder

review.reviewBody: Bladder leaked badly from where the hose connects to the bag the first time and every time I used it. I enjoyed the ability to easily pour from bladder to bottle/cook pot, but having to store the bladder in a waterproof bag in my pack wasn't worth it. I thought I could just adjust how it fit in the pack to avoid whatever pressure was causing it, but a fellow hiker notified me that my pack was dripping. Have gone back to the regular 3L bladder.
review.name: Good idea, but leaked.
comment: Thanks for leaving the review on our site.  I am sorry to hear about the issue you experienced.  It sounds like the problem will be covered under our warranty.  Please reach out to our customer service team for assistance.

name: 3D Hydro Trek 3L

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Took this backpacking to a relatively large lake that included some rock cliff jumping, after cooling off quickly in the cold water, this was the perfect thing to dry me off. Best part is once I was done, this too dried quickly so I could pack it back up.
review.name: Perfect addition to my gear for getting wet.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got the Sea Green one, and it us just as soft and gentle as the grey towel of the same size I bought a few years back. I use my grey one as a scarf, and this towel as a backup, and love them both.
review.name: Soft as an angel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If you are looking for a lightweight and space-saving option for outdoor activities, this towel is the right choice.
review.name: If you are looking for

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light and packable and worked well to bring along for a backpacking trip to use to dry off. This size is not large enough to wrap around to cover all your parts, but works to get your body dry. Dries quickly. And repacks I to it’s original casing for easy storage.
review.name: Great towel!

review.reviewBody: It's no surprise based on other reviews, but these towels are amazing. They really are quick-drying and soft to the touch. I have the pocket towel and XL towel and they were both lifesavers when a lot of my hostels either had no hand towel or a communal towel. It was so nice to have a towel for showering/beach and then a smaller one for drying hands and face after the bathroom or to wipe sweat. I could not recommend this product enough! Run, don't walk!
review.name: Most useful thing I bought for traveling

review.reviewBody: So good. Excellent texture that isn't "slimy" like some pack towels are. Get the XL if you want to cover all your bits. I am a pretty small woman and can barely manage with the large if I'm trying to take a wilderness bath. But the large is great for backpacking if you want to go really light.
review.name: So good. Excellent texture that

review.reviewBody: I love my pocket towel! It's tiny, the weight is very little but is still big enough to effectively dry me and wrap around my shoulders and it dries super quick. And it takes up so little space in my pack.
review.name: Best Backpacking Towel Ever

review.reviewBody: I have had a small blue pocket towel that my friend used to use - I always loved it, not just for sports and camping, but also to dry my hair! And as we were preparing for this big road trip, I paid attention to the label on my favorite 8 years old towel and ordered from Sea to Summit. I ordered Pocket and Drylite because I coudln't tell which one it was - we love the silky and lighter texture of Pocket Towel more than the suede and thicker texture of DryLite. Now we also use them to dry dishes and dry our hair and I am debating to throw out all my other dish clothes. Just getting the most out of these towels!
review.name: Love the towel

review.reviewBody: Quality and weight are fantastic. They just run a little small. We measured before ordering and they were still small. Would suggest going xl unless you just need a hand towel
review.name: Great quality towels

review.reviewBody:
International travel needs to be light, compact and easy to access on a train, plain or restroom. The Travel Light system fits all of these needs.
My wife and I are retiring and on our way to Scotland! The Traveling Light system is just the right size for a small travel bag and it is TSA approved. 

System Includes: Travelling Light Hanging Toiletry Bag / Traveling Light TPU Clear Zip Pouch with Bottles / Pocket Towel
review.name: Just the right size!

name: Pocket Towel

review.reviewBody: These are great shorts. Versatile enough for any situation you could possibly wear shorts for. Small side zipper pocket is nice. Don’t buy them expecting them to be exactly like the original breeze shorts but with a liner. They’re built different but that’s a good thing! Will be getting more in other colors.
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: I have ordered these shorts and shirts before. The do not disappoint. The bamboo lining makes the shorts comfortable and great to wear. I just wish they came in more colors.
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: These shorts are super comfortable - not always a given with lined shorts. They’re soft with a ton of stretch. I would wear these to fish, to work, or to lift. They look and feel great.
review.name: High Quality

review.reviewBody: I have multiple pairs of the Breeze Shorts and wanted to try out the new Active Breeze Shorts. I love them .
review.name: Lined Active Breeze Short

review.reviewBody: I loved the breeze shorts with bamboo pockets. I wanted these to be the exact same but with a liner. They missed the mark. Not made the same with the larger waist band, the liner is loose, and the pockets are just nylon. I’d say they’re ok but not as good as the OG.
review.name: Not as good as the OG

review.reviewBody: I loved the breeze shorts with bamboo pockets. I wanted these to be the exact same but with a liner. They missed the mark. Not made the same with the larger waist band, the liner is loose, and the pockets are just nylon. I’d say they’re ok but not as good as the OG.
review.name: Need tighter liner and bamboo pockets

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and well made. Probably my fav pair of leisure shorts. Big big fan.
review.name: Probably my favorite athletic shorts

review.reviewBody: My 4th pair. Love these shorts. Soft and extremely comfortable.
review.name: Great Shorts

review.reviewBody: I finally went ahead with the breeze shorts and am only sorry I didn't buy them sooner. I want to wear them all the time and everywhere, cuz they really are the most comfortable shorts I've ever worn!
review.name: First time buyer of Breeze shorts

review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable shorts I've evever worn. I highly recommend them. Can't wait to buy more!
review.name: Incredibly Comfortable Shorts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great looking boot, warm.  Toe box a little large compared to rest of boot. Will be good for thicker socks for extended hours outside.
review.name: Toe box

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love this boot! It’s lightweight yet very warm and stylish and comfortable.
review.name: Awesome boot!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super
Lightweight and comfortable. Warm with wool socks.  Recommend
review.name: Comfy warm boots

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfy and keeps feet warm. Love this shoe so much!
review.name: Great winter boots, def a great buy.

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a waterproof and supportive boot to wear during my daily walks in the winter. I walk about 5-7 miles each day. The support on these boots did not work for me. My legs were so fatigued and sore after a few miles in these boots. I tried using inserts with them and that only helped a little. I ended up returning them. If you have a high arches, these may not be the walking boots for you. I'm sure they're fine for errands and short distances. They're also very cute. But they didn't cut it for me unfortunately.
review.name: Cute, but not for walking distances!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got the Ice Maidens for myself last year, and got these this year for my mom. So you know these come highly recommended! Good soles make me feel secure on ice or in puddles, large boxy toe makes it so I can wear thick socks if I want. I like the look of boot. Easy-on, easy to lace at perfect tightness for whatever socks you have on, or for rough terrain. Good insulation- thick at the top, then moderate through the boot so it's not too hot and can be padded more with socks if desired. Light weight, water proof. They are good winter outdoor work boots.
review.name: for me, then had to get some for mom, too

review.reviewBody: It's what I expected excellent for the snow, They are brave, perfect
review.name: Snow boots

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So warm, comfortable and fashionable. I absolutely love them. Just what I needed.
review.name: So warm and fashionable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are fabulous. Very soft and comfortable. I love the way they slip on!
review.name: Great traction in the bottom!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these boots the day I left on a trip to spend 4-days in Chicago.  I put some insoles in them and wore them the entire trip walking anywhere from 8,000 to 20,000 steps a day.  They kept my feet warm when it got into the teens.
review.name: Excellent winter boots!

name: Ice Maiden Shorty Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect fit! Runs true to size. A little breaking in to do but was just what I was looking for
review.name: Possibly

review.reviewBody: This might be ridiculous, but this has been the only climbing shoe I have used, for all styles of climbing for about 8 years now.. I’m on my 5th pair. slab? Send it. Overhang? Send it. Heel hooks? Send it! I downsize and they stretch and break in perfectly! My heel seriously never pops out. And, they aren’t crazy stiff so when I toe down the shoe actually bends with the arch of my foot a little bit. At the price, I think everyone should try them. Plus, slip ons! Common!
review.name: My favorite climbing shoe of all time. Seriously.

review.reviewBody: Hunted for the right size, type of climbing shoes for ages. Finally found them. Robust, stiff soled, prefect for slabs and anything not overhung. So refreshing to be able to order climbing shoes in my street size and know they’re just right.
review.name: Finally the right climbing shoes

review.reviewBody: I read reviews that these are stiffer than the originals, so I finally decided to pick a pair for multipitches and crack climbing. The fit is snug and comfy but still on the wider side, with socks the side gaps are filled and the extra cushioning make it comfier for cracks. But that huge toe patch that I though was gonna help with durability but is on the wrong side of the shoe and thus it starts to peel off, if the rubber patch were on the outer side of the shoe, it wouldn't start to peel that early, that's just a design decision I don't understand. Regarding edging, it does the job well, it's not great, but not bad either, just good enough.
review.name: The patch is on the wrong side

review.reviewBody: Design definitely worth it very fit and safety too
review.name: Very good condition and fit for very hard exercis,

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really like the feel of these so far. I previously had the Anasi Moccasyms that these replaced, and after looking at reviews I went half a UK size up as the extra rubber apparently means they stretch less. A few sessions in they feel tight but comfortable, so we'll see how they break in over the next couple of months.
review.name: Feel great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the simplicity of no straps and fit perfect in my street size ! Nice and snug
review.name: Great pair of shoes

review.reviewBody: Good quality, comfortable. Definitely recommend to everyone
review.name: Go down 0.5-1 size from your normal shoes.

review.reviewBody: I don't know if I like them as much as the originals; however, I still really like this updated version (3rd pair, with a 10 year break from my 2nd to 3rd pair). I use them as my gym shoe for bouldering. They are super comfortable, and I have not ran into a problem where I thought I needed anything more aggressive. I went down a half size from street shoe, but I like a snug fit.
review.name: Still the best slipper on the market!!

review.reviewBody: Looks like women size when I ordered 11.5 men. Very disappointing
review.name: Too small and can't use had to give to my wife

review.reviewBody: If you have any amount of thigh meat and you want to lift your leg higher than 9 inches off the ground, these aren't the pants for you. Ironically, these pants are still too large in the waist despite being my normal size. I have an older model that I love and fit perfectly. I was hoping to reproduce that pair with these but to no success.
review.name: No Thigh Room

review.reviewBody: The Greenland Jeans (48EU/US32”, long/34” inseam) are my 1st pair of Fjallraven clothing.  I bought the Greenland Jeans, in Buckwheat Brown, because of their versatility. Quite literally they are the most versatile jeans/pants that I own. You can wear them on casual Fridays at the office, going out on the weekends, for hiking, chopping wood, camping, or even rock climbing. They are the most comfortable pair of jeans that I own, period. I can tell Fjallraven spent a good amount of time designing the proper fit for these jeans. To help customers, my dimensions are as follows 6’1.5” tall, 33 inch waist, and 33.5” inseam. Just like a pair of jeans they are comfortably fitted in the upper leg (10” inch width). The knee (9” inch width). The lower leg has a slight taper, but nothing dramatic or overdone, just a slight taper (I measure 8” inch width at the leg opening). The seat of the jeans (crotch) is gusseted which makes the jeans unrestrictive when taking longer strides hiking. The Greenland Jeans have an articulated knee which allows one to bend down and NOT have the jeans clinch or restrict when squatting. I further attest that these are the ONLY pair of jeans that I have ever owned that have a waist that does not bulge when bending down or leaning over. Meaning a tucked in shirt will stay tucked in these jeans – the rise of the jeans is spot on! The construction and materials are unbelievably robust. The stitching is tight and reinforced. Meaning these jeans, with proper care, will last a lifetime. I am not kidding about that either – that’s how well made these jeans are. The Greenland Jeans are made of the original G-1000 material (65% polyester, 35% Cotton). For customers, who might be shy of wearing “polyester looking” jeans you need not worry about that. To the touch and to the eye these jeans look like they are made of 100% cotton. The original G-1000 material these jeans are made of is light. This allows ample breathing on warmer days outside. They do not feel stuffy like 100% cotton jeans do. On cooler days these jeans hold up to wind and I feel no draft. One other wonderful quality about these jeans is that they are SUPER QUICK DRYING!!! No joke, I took these jeans out of the washer and hung dried them outside. 10 minutes later the legs were dry and the seat and pocket areas were about 85% dry – dry enough that if I were in a time crunch I would wear them and not feel wet. There was a light wind that day. On the topic of washing these jeans I would recommend hang drying these jeans just as Fjallraven recommends. Why? Because all clothing will last longer and maintain their original durability by hang drying. With these jeans, as I mentioned above, take only 10 minutes outside to dry or 15-20 minutes inside based on my experience. Plus, it is better on the environment to dry these via hang drying. If any customer viewing these jeans and reading this review it is my hope that this review will help aid your decision. You won’t regret the purchase and any justification can be explained by the fact that these jeans are timeless looking and will last a lifetime with proper care!
review.name: Greenland Jeans (long) Review

review.reviewBody:
Literally the best pant I've ever own, I particularly love the fit of these. almost a straight leg but with the perfect taper. 

I have been asking on social media and written emails to get these produced in Black, because that would make these the ultimate daily driver.
review.name: Perfect fit - Please make Black

review.reviewBody:
Got these like a month ago or so and wear them more than any other pants I own. Light, comfortable, sturdy, good with wind and they’ve got a handy thigh pocket. 
The only thing I didn’t like about them is the fifth pocket inside the right hand pocket. It had a large wide mouth on the inside, and being right handed I always put my phone in my right pocket, it was a chore putting my phone away. So I took the pocket out. Now I have no complaints!
review.name: Favourite pants

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and I've worn these on some quite cold days, but also great for casual city-life style. Agree with the mentioned note about them looking a bit 'formal enough' that they seem cool and not so casual to bring to the office as well.
review.name: 100% Recommend

review.reviewBody: I have a couple different pants from them that fit me. These do not. I'm a 35 waist and the 36 fits good. These however were completely different. The 36 was too wide in the waist and seat while the legs were so skinny I could barely get them on. No idea why these are so different. Too bad since the material was nice and pockets in a good spot. Btw the return was super easy although there's a 6 dollar return fee I wasn't expecting.
review.name: Good jeans but super weird fit

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite pants and I would love to get more colors.  These are comfortable but dressy enough for the office.  I love how lightweight they are and how the easily fit under my motorcycle pants. Please make more color options.
review.name: worn this style for years

review.reviewBody: Kinda surprised how light and thin these are. They are rugged, but the fabric’s tight weave doesn’t break in like jeans do. They also get dirty easier but they do wash out easier. Idk. I should have read more about them before I bought them. I was just looking for some jeans and these looked nice.
review.name: These are not jeans

review.reviewBody:
Loved these pants initially. Got the size 46 and they fit me perfectly. After wearing them sporadically over the course of a few weeks, the waistband stretched out so much - seemingly permanently - that I can basically fit my entire arm into the waistband along with my own waist. It's like the waist stretched out by 2 - 2.5 inches.

I've only washed according to instructions, and the rest of the garment fits the same as when I received it. I'm now considering putting them in the dryer briefly to try to force shrink them back to the initial waist size.

Really disappointing because they were so expensive and fit so well at first. I love Fjallraven products and have been a long time customer, but this purchase really backfired on me.
review.name: Loved these at first, now incredibly disappointed.

review.reviewBody: Long review but I hope somebody can appreciate the details. Firstly, I’ve known of this brand for many years and always wanted to own something from them because all of the marketing made them look like they were truly built for the outdoors. Regretfully this was my first purchase and not only do I not see myself buying these specific pants again, but now I’m worried about their other offerings as well. I believe these pants are better suited for drinking IPAs at your local brewery in a flannel (mustache optional but encouraged) and putting off the impression that you are super into the outdoors versus actually being great outdoor pants. First, as for fit, i found them to be true to size unlike other review. I’m 5’9ish 170ish lbs (semi athletic) and wear a 32 inseam/medium in virtually everything. I actually ordered a 34 based on other review and ended up exchanging them for 32 because they were too big in the waist. Length is a bit long (its in the name though) but for hiking I actually dont mind (IPA pants though and these need a good roll or hem). I do like the fit of these pants. I appreciate a more tailored fit, however, there is absolutely zero stretch to these pants. And although they do have a gusset any amount of high stepping does create quite a bit of tension on certain seams through the thigh and crotch region of these pants. It’s not so bad that it’s uncomfortable but it’s certainly the type of tension that overtime I would be worried about tearing seams. Speaking of seams, it is not that there’s anything wrong with the stitching but more that it is completely ordinary. I expected more spending $140 and I guess I also just thought that this company wouldn’t be manufactured in the same country that most house sporting good store brands are, or costco for that matter (sorry Costco, you know I still love you). And that is not to knock overseas manufacturing but to highlight the lack of value these pants offer. I could better justify buying these pants if they were $80 (I bought them using a $50 gift card) but paying $140 only to have to replace them in two or three years like I do most other branded (and cheaper) pants doesn’t make sense. The material of these pants is a stand out feature as I do imagine it would hold up well and feels great. As for the thigh pocket? Well it looks great. Like seriously great. Its the main reason i bought them (almost didnt want to admit that). But its functional value on the trail (vs your casual intown hang out) is much less so. I don’t hike with a map very often these days, and if i do its not the kind of thing I need immediate convenient access to. If you do hike with a map a lot I suppose this would be a good pocket for you. But anything thicker or less plyable than a map, say like your phone, snacks, or anything of real use, will quickly become a bother on the trail. Again due to the lack of stretch and tailored fit it just starts to bother my quad (that IPA punch card however would fit nicely) The problem is I do not buy $140 hiking pants to go out on the town with (more of a jeans kind of guy) and I think that is the niche these pants fill vs a true rough and functional outdoor pant. I really wanted to like these pants. And this brand. But now I’m hesitant. Would buying the $200 or $300 pants they offer give me the true outdoor pants my heart yearned for and that 10 years from now i am still wearing on my week long backpacking trips into the wilderness and on the many weekend missions? I am doubtful. But seriously, the look of this thigh pocket almost makes it worth it. Almost. See you downtown I guess.
review.name: I really wanted to like these pants…

review.reviewBody: Icebreaker used to pride themselves on their socks. However, in the last few years, the quality has diminished. Within a short window of time, the back heel starts to thin and the top of my nails poke through the front, even though I'm wearing larger socks than normal. review.reviewBody:
I was advised by a salesperson (gear head) and purchased PF92 boost/none-boost version. It comes with 2mm and 4.5mm adapters. Not sure which one comes with 4.5mm and 6.5mm adapters but I needed that. Now I have to purchase $16+shipping adapters kit in order to get 6.5mm one. 7-10 days waiting time is also very convenient in the middle of new bike build. 
 You have 7 adapters in drop menu. All with same details and tech specification. Why? To make everybody life miserable? 
When you sell headsets, bearings and BB's item description and tech spec's should be full and clear. Otherwise you'll deal with very unsatisfied customers like me at the moment.
review.name: Be careful

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The shoes are comfortable out of the box.
My only dissatisfaction is the strings are a little bit too short. Otherwise, good so far.
review.name: Good fit and comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my third pair of Targhee 3s. I have a lot of trouble finding shoes that are comfortable, don’t bother my knee and I can hike in. These fit the bill.
review.name: These are great shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve worn Keens for over 20 years and this is the first time the size I always get was way too big. Not sure what that means but I returned them and now the next size smaller is out of stock. Go figure
review.name: First time Keen was wrong size

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable and durable. the first pair lasted me about a year a factory and everyday use.. The sole started to separate from the shoe and fabric around foot hole started to fray after the year will be buying more pairs
review.name: 2nd time buying and just as good as the first pair

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice shoe but the soles don't last. These are a replacement for the pair I puchased last October. The soles on those came apart in less than 1 year.
review.name: mens targhee III

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I enjoy Keens, but they are very short-lived in their surface. Immediately comfortable,, but they fall apart far to0 soon. My recommendation to a friend will come with the caveat of "when?"
review.name: When will they fall apart?

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Keen makes a very well made shoe. They are comfortable as soon as you wear them and provide great support. This is my second pair and I know both will serve me well for many years.
review.name: Very Comfortable Quality Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Have been loyal to Keen for about twenty years, due to an orthopedics recommendation to avoid inserts. Over time I have noticed the quality in workmanship decrease. The soles are wearing out faster and have had several actually separate from the shoe. Would recommend these shoes only because the comfort and weather proofing still remains the same.
review.name: Quality

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and stylish. My go to everyday shoes. Highly recommend.
review.name: Looks great!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great shoes. Been wearing them for years. Very comfortable and stylish. My go to shoe for everyday wear.
review.name: Comfortable

name: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Hiking Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the The North Face All Weather 4-Wheeler 30in Roller Luggage online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: All Weather 4-Wheeler 30in Roller Luggage
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face All Weather 4-Wheeler 30in Roller Luggage online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love the clamshell design with even sides so you can open it flat to pack. It's a simple, strong design with good TSA locks. Easy to pick and easy to haul.
review.name: Great design.

review.reviewBody: I love everything about this suitcase and was super sad when I got to my destination on my first trip with my new suitcase, one wheel was broken off. I know bags get thrown violently but this should have not happened on its first checked trip!
review.name: Wheel broke on first trip.

review.reviewBody: I used this three times so far for international travel. The third time I travelled with it, the clasp actually exploded and the suitcase is completely bust! Besides that though, it did function really well prior to the clasp breaking. Smooth wheels, good storage. Maybe a bit on the heavier side, but definitely durable (until the clasp broke).
review.name: The clasps busted! But I'd give it another shot

review.reviewBody: All weather 4-wheeler is durable and comes with different sections to separate out items when packing, which I love! Perfect size when I need something larger than a carry-on.
review.name: Great piece of luggage!

review.reviewBody: Great check size baggage with enough room for 2 on long weekend trip. Split is in the center so it packs from both sides, no digging to get to the bottom items or each person can have a side. Very sturdy with double combination lock. Rollers are smooth makes it easy to maneuver.
review.name: great ceck in style baggage

review.reviewBody: First trip out will be November. Could use a handle on the bottom end; maybe a place for permanent ID tag.
review.name: Pretty much what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: Solid luggage easy to travel with and decent storage. It does require strength to close but perhaps that makes it more secure. It's beautiful and I receive so many compliments.
review.name: Beautiful

review.reviewBody: the buckles attached to the interior very easily ripped right out of the wall of the bag when tightening down. Also already have a missing foot support for sitting on its side. seems to have been poorly secured as well from a design/engineering standpoijt
review.name: Poor quality Assemblies

review.reviewBody: Hard side case seems much more durable than any of her cases I've owned. Locks are heavy duty.
review.name: Quality product

review.reviewBody: Great for a week long vacation. Compartments and bags kept everything organized. Seemed to hold up well after being tossed around at the airport; no damage. Recommend for hard side luggage.
review.name: Large capacity; plenty compartments.

name: All Weather 4-Wheeler 30in Roller Luggage

description: Buy the Gregory Alpaca Wide Mouth Case 25L online or shop all Overlanding from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alpaca Wide Mouth Case 25L
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Alpaca Wide Mouth Case 25L online or shop all Overlanding from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Alpaca Wide Mouth Case 25L
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Alpaca Wide Mouth Case 25L online or shop all Overlanding from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Finally!! After so many other bags, this one has the sturdiness yet flexibility to close (the handle is perfection) and fits a 10L and 5L gearpod with pocket items and items biner’d on the outside. Thanks Gregory!
review.name: The uber dopp kit for adventure moms

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's what I've become to expect from Gregory products. Well designed, functional and looks nice.
review.name: Alpaca wide mouth case

review.reviewBody: I just got this bag because I thought it would be a great size to keep all of the dog food and gear organized for road trips. It’s a good size because it fit quite a bit in the open position and it doesn’t take up much room in the closed (zipped up) position. I’m a contractor and the design is very similar to a wide mouth tool bag which I like. It’s a great grab and go kind of bag, so Im going to use it for work (laptop, paper work, water bottle etc. It has a bigger pocket on the outside which is just right for a phone and external battery. There’s three small pockets on the inside which is also great. The framed zipper feels very durable and the huge zipper pulls are comfortable. I would like to see webbing on the outside similar to the alpaca duffle if I could change anything. There are four little key or carabiner loops on the outside of the bag but for travel I always appreciate Molle webbing. Also for the price of the bag I wish it included a shoulder strap, you could easily attach one yourself but the only points to clip to might be flimsy with a fully loaded bag.
review.name: Great overall bag, simple but useful

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product from influenster in exchange for my honest review. This bag is super good, lots of space, the material is fantastic and the color is beautiful. Multifunctional… I love it
review.name: Amazing!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This wide mouth case is so durable and holds so much. I love how rugged it is. I keep all of our in the go supplies in here for long car trips.  The only thing I wish it had was a detachable strap. Otherwise this is truly a great find.
review.name: Durable storage with tons of space

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Amazing quality bag very heavy duty. Perfect bag for overnight or a full weekend . I've used it a bunch of times and it shows no wear and it's been through the woods on numerous occasions.
review.name: Great quality and heavy duty!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They recommend this bag as a large toiletry or small electronics bag. This would definitely work as an electronics bag but my husband has tried to claim it for himself for his tools and other gadgets. The quality is nice and the size is good. I would highly recommend.
review.name: Gret bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product from Influenster for free for a exchange for my honest opinion. I love how I can put a lot of things into this case. Whenever I go out of town I use this to carry my clothes in. I would recommend this product.
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is the perfect size for one person.  The bag is a High quality durable travel bag with all the space one would need. It had. Section for cosmetics and also a deep
Pocket for clothes.
review.name: Perfect weekender

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wow! I can’t say enough great things about this bag. The quality is absolutely top notch. The heavy duty zippers and fabric seem like it will hold up for a really long time. It’s a great size bag and is perfect for traveling, short trips, or any sort of adventure you might find yourself on. There are plenty of pockets and loops for carabiners to be able to attach things to it as well. Amazing bag overall.
review.name: Amazing bag and quality

name: Alpaca Wide Mouth Case 25L

description: Buy the Zipp Speed Box Frame Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Speed Box Frame Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Zipp Speed Box Frame Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is a great, sleek frame bag.  It is very smal-about 6 gels will fit but for really long rides and challenged shoulder flexibility to use jersey pockets, it has been great!
review.name: Small box for road bike

review.reviewBody:
The shape means the stem bolts (around your steerer) get in the way of securing it tightly, so it's going to flop around. Not a ton, but enough to be annoying. The bottom straps are thin and the mounting design is poor (there's a flap of fabric running the length of the bottom, and they strap through that flap, leaving a lot of literal wiggle room) so it's not super stable. It's not going to fall off your bike, but you will be adjusting it all the time. Super narrow, so it fits remarkably little stuff for the size.

Stick to a design with sewn-in velcro straps, e.g. from Revelate or Dark Speed Works.
review.name: Big size flops around a lot

review.reviewBody: This bag is a great size for keys and a few bars. It is not large enough to hold an iPhone 6, however it?s narrow profile and rigid sides kept it from scraping against the inside of my knees while peddling.
review.name: Great snack bag

name: Speed Box Frame Bag

hasVariant.description: Buy the WTB Volt Cromoly Saddle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought an Ibis Exie, and due to stock issues, this saddle was swapped in as a replacement for the Silverado. Once I built it up, I wanted to ride the Exie immediately and kept the stock saddle on for that ride. I'm glad I did. It's great! It is the only padded saddle I can even stand to ride long in. I have swapped all my MTBs over to this saddle and am seriously considering swapping all my bikes over. I'm a saddle snob and honestly shocked that a 'cheap' saddle would become my favorite.
review.name: Came stock, but loved it

review.reviewBody: This saddle is very comfortable. First time I have purchased a wide seat. Should have done it years ago.
review.name: Great big guy seat

review.reviewBody: The Volt is my second attempt at finding a suitable saddle for my gravel bike. I like it because it is affordable with just the right amount of cushioning. The chromoly rails seemed like the perfect choice for my chromoly bike. I went with a size medium and I would say it is a perfect fit for my 6’1” 175lbs frame. The saddle feels equally good when riding in the drops and on the hoods. At first, I wasn’t too impressed. However, I started to micro adjust each time I took the bike out and finally found the sweet spot. So, if an open saddle isn’t your cup of tea, I would definitely recommend giving the Volt a try.
review.name: Saddle search is over

review.reviewBody: Best seat ever.  Might not be something weight nuts would love or Racers would want but for someone that goes on 2-3 hour single track rides 1 or 2 times a week, it is perfect.  I have a medium width on my enduro bike and the wide on my hardtail.  So smart of me, so smart.
review.name: My Bum is in Love

name: Volt Cromoly Saddle

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Shoes are comfortable and so far seem durable. I wish the sole was a little stiffer because I get a hot spot around the cleat, but if the sole was stiffer they probably wouldn't be as comfortable for when you have to walk. I bought these looking for comfort because my feet seem to have widened the last few years, and these fit the bill perfectly.

Warrantied by Adidas, thank you.   But I cannot recommend.

review.reviewBody:
Great hiking shoe for the summer - not too hot and supports my foot and especially my arches well.  Toe box is roomy enough - love their grip on rock and sandy surfaces.
I washed them a few times in a washing machine (probably not recommended but I do not care) and they come out very clean.
review.name: Comfy & yet well performing hiking shoe

review.reviewBody: These shoes have great cushioning and support, but are lightweight and not bulky. They are very comfortable and have plenty of room in the toe box, but still have a relatively sleek, trim silhouette (as far as hiking shoes go). Many thanks to the Chicago store team for the perfect recommendation!
review.name: Comfort & support without the bulk

name: Katabatic Low Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I returned the shorts. I like an MTB short to hardy, the fabric was very thin. And, the way the waist cinch strap works as low functioning, anything in your pockets, and the shorts are sliding down. Redesign should include a heavier gauge fabric and better waste cinch.
review.name: Returned

review.reviewBody:
Like, I get it. Shorts are getting to be a bit longer these days, and it's nice because you don't get "gaper-gap" between your shorts and knee pads, but good lord these things are long.  They fit me more like clam diggers.  

I never actually rode in them. They seem nice, but I wanted shorts not capris.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wore this jacket for ski lessons as a beginner. I was concerned if I would be warm enough with it being in the low 20s and actively snowing, but this jacket kept me super warm with minimal layers underneath! In fact, I was too warm and had to unzip the jacket!
review.name: Super Warm!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got the jacket. Fits great. Really happy with my purchase.
review.name: Fits great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fit is good I like the extra pockets keeps me warm
review.name: I would but this product again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this coat in boysenberry after Chicago got hit with lots of snow and below zero temperatures. As I was out shoveling, I discovered the designer winter coat I bought from a big department store was NOT waterproof. Unfortunately, I weigh 274, so finding a coat isn't easy. After researching, I decided to try this one even though it is over $300. It fits great (it isn't loose, but it is comfortable and I can sit with it zipped)! It also is not puffy, so there is no added bulk. The sleeves are nice in that they are not too short and I can tighten them at the wrist with the Velcro. I also love the chest pocket--I put my phone in there and can listen to a podcast as I walk my dog. Well worth the money!
review.name: So nice AND handy chest pocket!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great option for quality plus size gear - I am tall and the arm length is great! The material is great quality, and with the low temps of Maine, it's a solid jacket choice that keeps you warm, but not too warm for skiing. Would definitely recommend!
review.name: Great product for plus size!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this coat it keeps me warm and dry and plenty of pockets.
review.name: Plenty of pockets

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I luv my Jacket its warm and comfortable
review.name: I would by this product again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It didn't fit right but was nice
review.name: Didn't fit right needed smaller size

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this for my daughter and she loves it!!!
review.name: I'd buy again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A great plus size cold weather jacket. I love the goggle/glasses cleaning cloth. All the vents are fantastic. I appreciate that it isn't cut so slimmly that I feel like a sausage casing!!
review.name: Big girls ski too
