review.reviewBody: Great fit, comfortable but looks sharp - works for the weekend or a night out,  to too heavy, not too thin
review.name: Love this shirt

review.reviewBody:
I love flannels. I have a ton from other company's that are competitive with Mammut. Last year I bought a winter coat that is absolutely amazing, so I thought I'd try a flannel out.

Compared to other flannels I own (Patagonia, Arcteryx, Outdoor Research) I would put this in the realm with Arcteryx. It's much more 'professional' than anything else. It's very slim/trim fit, so it doesn't have that feel of wanting to wear it hiking or camping. It's more of a shirt to wear if you're going to a pumpkin patch or orchard to take family photos. Or dress it up a bit and wear it to work. 

It's a fantastic shirt and super comfortable, I just don't suggest it for any strenuous activities. With that said though, I'll probably get more when they're in stock. I will be wearing them to work.
review.name: Solid shirt, a bit tight

review.reviewBody:
I love flannels. I have a ton from other company’s that are competitive with Mammut. Last year I bought a winter coat that is absolutely amazing, so I thought I’d try a flannel out.

Compared to other flannels I own (Patagonia, Arcteryx, Outdoor Research) I would put this in the realm with Arcteryx. It’s much more ‘professional’ than anything else. It’s very slim/trim fit, so it doesn’t have that feel of wanting to wear it hiking or camping. It’s more of a shirt to wear if you’re going to a pumpkin patch or orchard to take family photos. Or dress it up a bit and wear it to work. 

It’s a fantastic shirt and super comfortable, I just don’t suggest it for any strenuous activities. With that said though, I’ll probably get more when they’re in stock. I will be wearing them to work.
review.name: Solid shirt, a bit tight

review.reviewBody: The shirt is really soft, has great styling and looks great
review.name: Flannel shirt

review.reviewBody: Fabric is super soft, shirt would be comfortable... if it fit. Size Large? I think they put the wrong tag on a medium. It was snug in the chest, shoulders, arms, and neck, and I'm not a big guy. Just order a size up from your normal if you get this.
review.name: Great shirt, horrible size

review.reviewBody: It's a great shirt for fall hikes, hanging around at the campsite, or just in the city. Also, looks great. I liked it so much that I bought a second one in a different color. I am 175 lbs, 171 cm, broad shoulders and size Large fits me well.
review.name: Love this shirt!

review.reviewBody: I bought three of these flannels in different colors. They're very comfortable however after only a few wears one of them developed a tear by the wrist where the buttons connect. I'd expect better durability from a brand like Mammut.
review.name: Comfort level is high, durability is low

review.reviewBody: Great shirt. Only gripe is the buttoned portion around the wrist is loose.
Very comfortable material, looks great (i mean as good as an old sea-dog can look anyway). Seems to wash well without too many wrinkles.
review.name: Classy Comfort

review.reviewBody: This shirt fits and feels great. I wish I could get another one in the slightly different color.
review.name: Love this Shirt

name: Trovat Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: I Love these booties so much. Wish they had more colors.
review.name: I would buy these again and again.

review.reviewBody: Love these! I wanted them last season but they sold out. They're like my slippers, warm, comfy and waterproof, but in a boot, which is perfect for days that the snow is above ankle level.
review.name: Finally got my hands on these!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a nice boot (warm, looks good, and seems to be of good quality) and true to size, but I ended up returning it because I didn't like the elastic pull cord as it makes the boot bunch and go lower on your calf. I think a Velcro strap would work better as I used to have a similar bootie in a different brand with a Velcro strap to tighten it.
review.name: Nice boot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very warm boots! I wear them for what they're intended for and they work great!
review.name: Warm and cozy for winter

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the best slippers I have ever purchased for my wife. She wears them all day and can't be more happy.
review.name: Best slippers EVER

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome product and store their name holds up to their word about product
review.name: I would buy anything from north face again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These were a birthday gift for my daughter in law and I had to return them for a smaller size. They're great boots even nicer in person, so she hated she'd have 2 wait to wear them, but I purchased the replacement immediately and they came in just 2 days. She is very happy with these boots.
review.name: I will be buying a pair for myself next

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] they provided decent warmth for my feet, I have some mixed feelings about them. On the positive side, these booties definitely excel in keeping my feet warm during colder weather. Whether I'm running errands or lounging at home, my feet remain cozy and comfortable, which is a huge plus. However, where these booties fall short is in the support department. As someone who walks a lot throughout the day, I found that these booties lack the necessary support for extended periods of walking. After a long day on my feet, I noticed some discomfort and fatigue due to the lack of support provided by the booties.
review.name: Decent Warmth, Lacks Support: Women's Nuptse Apres Booties

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These were a gift for my daughter. She LOVES them Always speaks about how comfortable and warm they are.
review.name: I would buy this product again and again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ski trip, kept my feet nice and warm. Then they came in handy week after, we had a snow storm in my city.I love my booties. They are comfortable and warm.
review.name: I would definitely buy these again.

hasVariant.name: Active Skin 12L Running Hydration Vest + Flasks - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon Active Skin 12L Running Hydration Vest + Flasks - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Active Skin 12L Running Hydration Vest + Flasks - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Love love the vest. Very comfortable and a variety of pockets, easy to carry phone, snacks, keys, water - everything you need to keep you going.

*Haven't rated the durability because I have only used it for a few months now but it still looks brand new!
review.name: Excellent fit!

review.itemreviewed: Active Skin 12L Running Hydration Vest + Flasks - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have purchased many kits, and I can say without a doubt that SOLOMON nailed it with this kit!! I am a distance runner training for my first 50K and this kit stays in place even with a C cup bra size. The others on the market move around and cause you to chaff. This kit is Genius with the draw string so you can snug it up how much you need/prefer. Don’t think twice, JUST BUY IT. IT WILL CHANGE YOU RUN!
review.name: BEST RUNNING KIT ON THE MARKET!!!!

review.itemreviewed: Active Skin 12L Running Hydration Vest + Flasks - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this pack for a multi day trip around Mount Blanc which required carrying extra gear due to weather conditions.  I have a 5L so am familiar with the features and felt comfortable ordering this one. Everything worked great as far as pocket accessibility, water bottles, and pack comfort. The major  disappointment was that it had no loops the attach poles or a sleeve. Not sure if this is standard on this model or if Backcountry just sold me an older model wo the options. Fortunately I was able to rig a system with my loops from the other vest that attached them on my back. I just had to take the vest on and off to get to them. Otherwise, great storage for what I needed
review.name: Great pack but no pole carry features

review.itemreviewed: Active Skin 12L Running Hydration Vest + Flasks - Women's
review.reviewBody: If you're looking to use this for longer runs this is a great product for that. I have been really impressed with how much I am able to fit in the bag, but also
review.name: Everything you need

review.itemreviewed: Active Skin 12L Running Hydration Vest + Flasks - Women's
review.reviewBody: So much space for my snacks! Very comfortable! It’s beautiful
review.name: Love it!

review.itemreviewed: Active Skin 12L Running Hydration Vest + Flasks - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great vest for longer days on the trails! Followed the size chart. 32B and 115 lbs. Ordered the XS. Make sure to try on with a full pack and get a tight fit.
review.name: Great women’s vest

review.itemreviewed: Active Skin 12L Running Hydration Vest + Flasks - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the new women's specific color! Fit is very comfortable and stayed true to size. Make sure to try it on with the bottles and pockets filled :)
review.name: Perfect vest

review.itemreviewed: Active Skin 12L Running Hydration Vest + Flasks - Women's
review.reviewBody: had this vest for a couple weeks now and it’s been my saving grace. my measurements had me at a size XS but i went with the S due to the arm holes. fits snug and there’s little to no bouncing on my runs!
review.name: love it!

review.itemreviewed: Active Skin 12L Running Hydration Vest + Flasks - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the lighter colour option for summer. Revised women’s fit is much closer to the unisex fit. Arm hole sizing was not an issue. Fits true to size as per the size chart.
review.name: Nice update

review.itemreviewed: Active Skin 12L Running Hydration Vest + Flasks - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this vest as my daughter purchased a similar one and was raving about it.  I am so glad i got it, it holds everything I need on my mid length runs, and if I need more hydration, i can put my bladder in it from another running pack.  I love the fit, I'm 5'2", 34 chest and the small fits perfect.  I love the color as well, I got the Moonscape.  Very happy and highly recommend
review.name: Why didn't I get this sooner!

name: Active Skin 12L Running Hydration Vest + Flasks - Women's

review.reviewBody: I’ve worn this jacket maybe 8 times and the zipper split at the bottom out on the slopes in 20 degree temps. Not impressed.
review.name: Poor quality.
comment: Hi there, thank you so much for your review. We’re so sorry to hear about your experience with the Lawrence Jacket. We’d love the opportunity to make this right, please check your email for a message from our Customer Experience team.

review.reviewBody: Great jacket with great warmth while still being slim.
review.name: Loved it.

review.reviewBody: I absolutely loved this jacket! It kept me warm on the slopes and all the pockets were perfect. Halfdays thought of everything!
review.name: Lawrence jacket

review.reviewBody: Excellent jacket! Love the material, the phone leash and the pass pocket on the arm. Although I'm usually a size medium (5'5" ~155lbs) I sized up to a large and it fits really well, roomy enough to add layers, but not bulky at all. The only thing I wish it featured is a detachable hood, I almost purchased the Aston jacket because of the removable hood, the hood isn't bothersome on the lift or in the turns. Thank you Halfdays!!!
review.name: Lawrence Jacket

review.reviewBody: My sister, and her daughters all LOVE the Lawrence jacket, which I got them for christmas. Best uncle/brother award, right here! They loved it so much they ended up buying the same jacket in other colors!
review.name: Could a snow jacket be perfect? YES!

review.reviewBody: The dreamy fit, weight, function & style makes the Lawrence the jacket I turn to every winter! It's a wardrobe staple when the temperature drops- even when I'm not on the slopes!
review.name: Obsessed with the Lawrence!

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love the color and how it fits!
review.name: Favorite ski outfit so far

review.reviewBody: This jacket checks EVERY single box! I have been on the hunt for the perfect ski jacket for years - the fit, the color, and all the technical elements of the design make this my forever favorite Half Days piece!
review.name: The best ski jacket you'll ever find

review.reviewBody:
I love the Lawrence Jacket! My favorite features are:
1, The hood that fits over my helmet
2. The various pockets that help me keep my essentials close and dry 
3, Vibrant color that has held up with lots of wear, washing, and driving 

I have worn this jacket in every condition on the mountain from blue bird days to sunny skies and it has kept me warm, comfortable, and looking great. From advanced terrain to groomers, it performs exceptionally well and the cell phone leash has saved me from losing my phone many times!
review.name: Comfortable, Stylish, High Performance

review.reviewBody: I bought the Lawernce Jacket and matching pants in Alpine Green and when I wear them together I get asked if I work for the forestry service so maybe I should have gone for another color.  It's a great jacket with lots of pockets in the right spot. I appreciate the cell phone leash and the goggle whips built in.  It would be nice if the front zipper pull was a bit bigger or had a cord on it to make zipping up with gloves on easier like the pocket zippers have.  And the collar could be a bit roomier to Zip up when wearing a neck gator.
review.name: Forestry Green

name: Lawrence Jacket - Women's

description: Buy the Ortovox Westalpen Softshell Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Westalpen Softshell Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ortovox Westalpen Softshell Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I wore these pants for 9 days of alpine rock and glacier travel recently. They performed well in a wide range of conditions (hot, cold, wet, dry) and exceeded expectations. I only added a longer base layer on the very coldest summit day (below freezing).

Especially nice was the heat-dumping side zips. Integrated gaiters worked well, and when combined with a hardshell pant I was able to do a stream crossing without getting any water in my boots even without an external gaiter.
review.name: Absolutely my favorite pant

name: Westalpen Softshell Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I’m a “normal” sized cyclist, an XL in Castelli jerseys and bibs. I ordered an XXL of this jacket and didn’t want to zip it up all the way of fear the zipper would pop off and take out someone’s eye. It is a very slim fit. Going back to Competitive for refund. This one is for the >20% body fat crowd.
5’8
187 lbs
44” chest/jacket
36” waist ( what can I say ?)
review.name: Fantastic ! ( If you’re 120 lbs )

review.reviewBody: I already had Castelli Alpha RoS 2 and Alpha RoS Light, but picked this up to handle the temps above 55F.  Was well rewarded when paired with light long sleeve base and temp warmed from 52 to 59F.  Stops wind dead and and never overheats or feels swampy.  Have rolled with it and a heavier base down to mid-40s very happily. Polartec carries the day beautifully.  As usual for Castelli, size up if in doubt.
review.name: Never underestimate Castelli Jackets

name: Beta RoS Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Outpulse Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Not bad Not bad Not bad Not bad Not bad Not bad Not bad  Not bad
review.name: Good overall

review.itemreviewed: Outpulse Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Owned about 6 months, wore 5 times. Only camping trip, no hikes. Metal shoelace holder broke off and then just tore at ankle.
review.name: Do not buy, falls apart
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Outpulse Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: these boots feel amazing. no toe rubbing, great support but paired with ultimate flexibility and movement where it matters. tried so many pairs of boots that hurt my feet and ankles but these felt amazing from the moment i put them on. THE PERFECT BOOT
review.name: wide toe box very comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Outpulse Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: seams failed within 2 years and Salomon won't replace, calling that normal wear and tear.  Garbage.  Check out Vasque, their products hold up and management supports their customers.
review.name: poor quality and no backing by Salomon

review.itemreviewed: Outpulse Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
These are my absolute favorite hiking shoes ever. They fit perfectly, are lightweight, and have great grip. Unfortunately they have the worst manufacturing and assembly. After the first pair I bought busted holes in the top, I thought it was a one-off thing. But after buying two more pairs and having the same thing occur, I am really disappointed. 

There are huge holes that form after just a few months of wearing them. This is from a couple backpacking trips and local hiking, not a thru trail or anything. You can tell that Salomon went really cheap and dirty with the manufacturing and it sucks.
review.name: Best boots, Worst manufacturing
comment: Hi. We’re sorry for any inconvenience. We’re glad to confirm to you that a case has been opened to address your concerns, and we’re waiting for your answer. Please check your inbox!

review.itemreviewed: Outpulse Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have fairly wide feet and I thought these would be a great option. I sized a 1/2 size up, but they were still too narrow.  I wore them around the house to try to break in but no dice.  Slick lookin shoe, but I went with a different brand.
review.name: Comfortable but narrow

review.itemreviewed: Outpulse Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am so happy with these boots. They were comfortable from the minute I put them on. They are less stiff and structured than I expected, but this has made them extremely comfortable for city walking as well as day hikes. No chafing, no blisters! I haven’t had them out in pouring rain yet. The sole has been a little less “grippy” on wer trail footing than other boots but it’s not been an issue at all yet. I am curious to see how they do in extremely wet weather.
review.name: So comfortable!

review.itemreviewed: Outpulse Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the shoes, but it seems that the right shoe is not Seated correctly.  The right shoe makes some noise with each step
review.name: Very comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Outpulse Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Use these off trails with a heavy pack in mountainous areas of Montana and loved them. They are very comfortable and still sturdy enough. They aren’t super waterproof but that makes them breathable. Great summer to fall, responsive hikers!
review.name: Very comfortable, light weight but sturdy boots!

review.itemreviewed: Outpulse Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I really like the fit of these shoes because I have a high arch, wide foot and narrow ankle.
review.name: I love the fit and color scheme and shoelaces.

name: Outpulse Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Olympus 5 Hike Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these before an 8 day hiking trip and it was my best purchase for the trip. The Vibram sole was excellent climbing up rocks and my feet never hurt.  I'd wear them full time if I could!
review.name: Glad I bought them

review.itemreviewed: Olympus 5 Hike Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: On first day wearing in rain - they soaked right through
review.name: Very disappointed- they are not waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Olympus 5 Hike Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Nice a roomy, never had box toe shoes, good for walking and working in
review.name: Good working shoe

review.itemreviewed: Olympus 5 Hike Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have tried on at least 20 different shoes/boots for hiking which I really need for walking on uneven terrain in fields. I'm on my 4th pair of Paradigms and my 3rd pair of Lone Peaks....and I loved this shoe when I first saw it...but it was squeezy, and hardly felt like a large toe box. I returned the 9.5 which is already on the large side for me and got a size 10. They are so comfortable now I never want to take them off! I think the Goretex addition reduces the actual size of the shoe somehow, so I would recommend sizing up a 1/2 size.
review.name: Got the right fit...can't take them off!!

review.itemreviewed: Olympus 5 Hike Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I originally bought these for a trip to Iguazu Falls. They worked great for me. My feet were quite warm but it was 107 degrees. Everyone commented on how tough these shoes look. I now wear them for working in my yard, going through wet grass, the woods or over rocks and mud. They get dirty and wet and offer great support and I just wipe them clean. I have bunions and use additional arch support and toe spacers with plenty of room. They fit me similar to my Paradigm Wides.
review.name: Waterproof supportive roomy and tough!

review.itemreviewed: Olympus 5 Hike Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was hoping to replace my Olympus 4 hiking shoe with the 5.  The reviews were mixed so thought I would give them a try and sure enough; they are too narrow in the mid section for me.
review.name: narrow

review.itemreviewed: Olympus 5 Hike Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I hike in my altras and this has been my go-to for awhile now. I have LOVED this brand and it's shoes! I ordered 2 pairs online this time, one waterproof and the other not, feeling super confident in the sizing and fit after living in my other pairs. But I can't even wear these ones!! They seriously squeeze my toes. I have wasted my money and now I'm a bit lost trying to find a new shoe before a big, thru hiking trip I've been looking forward to all year. Altra, I was here for the roomy, wide toe box. Please bring it back
review.name: Umm... what happened to the roomy toe box??

review.itemreviewed: Olympus 5 Hike Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is a very nice shoe. I was excited to find a waterproof Olympus because I love my other Olympus shoes so much. But I am EXTREMELY disappointed that the toe box is smaller, even though all Olympus shoes are listed as having the "original" toe box. It is subtle, but enough for my duck-shaped feet to feel it. It might be that the materials on the waterproof Olympus are just thicker and not that the toe box is actually smaller. If that's the case, I hope they can be broken in to be more comfortable there.
review.name: Did the toe box shrink?

review.itemreviewed: Olympus 5 Hike Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am a long time Olympus fan. I was excited to get the waterproof version but they are not even close to the same shoe. The biggest issue is that the heel is so shallow that my foot almost slides out of the shoe with every step. No amount of different lacing helps. So disappointing, I really needed these shoes to work.
review.name: Heel is way too shallow.

review.itemreviewed: Olympus 5 Hike Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am a Respiratory Therapist and I work in a Level #4 Neonatal Intensive Care Unit. Things can get pretty busy, lots and lots of foot work involved. I was extremely impressed at the comfort level of these shoes as soon as I put my feet in them.
review.name: Omgheeeeee Winner Winner!!

name: Olympus 5 Hike Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Blackburn Core Pro Floor Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Core Pro Floor Pump
hasVariant.description: Buy the Blackburn Core Pro Floor Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Pump valving is terribly loose, if you pump to slow the valve wont seal and you build no pressure, so you must pump wicked fast to push any air.  If you were hoping that it would be a good pump for seating tubless tires you better turn back now, it takes decades to pump even the smallest 23mm tires. The pump head is poorly designed and bends presta valves. This thing is a glorified paper weight and does not belong in anybodys shop or garage.
review.name: This pump is a waste of space.

review.reviewBody: I rarely write reviews.  I should have given up on this pump when I had to return/exchange the first one I ordered because it didn't work on arrival.  Takes forever to pump up mtb tires and I'm pretty sure it bends the interior part of presta valves.  It's a pump... should be straightforward.  My previous Topeak lasted 15 years.  Don't waste $100 on this pump.
review.name: stay away

name: Core Pro Floor Pump

review.itemreviewed: Cave TLS Step On Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I have been riding my Burton step on bindings with a burton type boot that has a true stiffness flex rating of 8 for 3+ years now on 2 different boards with their own bindings. The problem is they (Burton) did not continue to make the boots for women! So I got a chance to try these on in store after reading they had similar specs to the Burton boot… and what a huge let down! I have never worn Nitro and it looks like I never will! First off is the shrink it and pink it syndrome where manufacturers simply change the color of product and for some strange reason shrink it down to unrealistic sizes and slap a “women’s” label on it. 

So the inner boot liner was so small that I couldn’t get the Velcro to secure around my leg! I tried on my normal size of 8 and the toe box was so horribly tight and rubbing that I thought I had tried on the wrong size, so anticipate these to run tight and narrow. Lastly the worst of all is the misleading flex rating of 7/8, which is a giant joke. These boots are soft with a mid flex of a 5 stiffness with minimal stiffness and maximum flex, despite the two tongue stiffeners which hardly did anything. 

The snowboarding industry is a huge let down for me as a woman! Making things too small and inferior to my level and style of riding! My husband tried on the men’s version of these and he was instantly disappointed with the false flex rating listed on these boots too and I ordered him our favorite Burtons!
review.name: Not for everyone

name: Cave TLS Step On Snowboard Boot - 2024 - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Xperior Hybrid RAIN.RDY Rain Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Great waterproof jacket. Well designed and highly functional.
My only complaint is the non-adjustable hood which comes down over my eyes obstructing my view.  Some adjustable elastic would be a welcome edition to make this the perfect wet weather jacket.
review.name: Great design and highly functional with zip pocket

review.itemreviewed: Xperior Hybrid RAIN.RDY Rain Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Really well designed, light weight and properly waterproof!
Love the design of this jacket. For once Adidas have produced a very functional, highly useable jacket with Zip pockets in the right places, and no extreme logo's.  It fits really well and has decent hood.
My only complaint is that the hood elastics are non-adjustable, and I find the hood comes down over my eyes which is very annoying, and i have to fold it back to see where i am going!
review.name: Great design, and properly waterproof

description: Buy the Santa Cruz Bicycles Nomad C GX Eagle Transmission Coil Mountain Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Nomad C GX Eagle Transmission Coil Mountain Bike
hasVariant.description: Buy the Santa Cruz Bicycles Nomad C GX Eagle Transmission Coil Mountain Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Nomad C GX Eagle Transmission Coil Mountain Bike
review.reviewBody:
Been riding this bike all year with tons of bike park days here in Utah, Washington, and BC. This bike makes me feel like a hero even though my skills are far from it. The mixed wheels are perfect for riding steep terrain and feel at home in tight twisty corners. The kit on this build is the perfect mix of drivetrain and suspension components. If I had the extra cash I would splurge and go with the Reserve wheels though. 
Typical of Santa Cruz, the frame quality, fit and finish is industry-leading. I've put many hard days on this bike and put it through the ringer and it still feels just as good as the day I got it. Add a lifetime warranty on the frame, free bearings for life, and the stiff nature of the frame and I have no doubt this bike is ready for many more miles of abuse.
If you're looking for a big bike that can handle big days, look no further.
review.name: Bike Park Brute

name: Nomad C GX Eagle Transmission Coil Mountain Bike

hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Pursuit ChromaPop Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Had these for less than a year and one temple arm busted after a small fall backcountry skiing. Smith doesn't stock replacement arms and won't honor their warranty policy, so you're kind of screwed if anything happens to the arms.
review.name: Good luck getting replacement parts

review.reviewBody: the pursuits are good at what they say they do. they don’t stay on, though - and there’s no way to tighten the fit. I wear a size M in helmets from smith and have no issues with the fit of the wildcats. I don’t trust these to stay on for skiing, mountaineering, or biking. used them for mountain biking today and they were blocking my vision within a minute of starting on the downhill, and I had issues with them staying on all winter for mountain pursuits.
review.name: giant on my normal sized head

review.reviewBody: I bought these for a trip on Mt Shasta in April. They are really well made but fairly light. the lenses work well for a super wide range of lighting from extremely bright in the middle of day to dimmer sunset. I found them quite comfy and basically wore them for my whole trip. The included features (nose shield, side shields) are all nice and easy to install/remove.
review.name: Worked great!

review.reviewBody: Us normal faced people would love a pursuit style sunny in the bobcat size. I know many people who would love to love these, but they are simply too big! Bobcat is the perfect size for smaller faces and still has that goggle sized fit.
review.name: My face is not that huge

review.reviewBody:
Having used these glasses for a lot of backcountry skiing this season, including a traverse of the Haute Route, I feel like I can provide some meaningful feedback. For their intended purpose, they are excellent. Fit, coverage, and optics are all fantastic. The lens works well in bright alpine/glacier sun at 3000+ meters. I didn’t experience any eye fatigue during whatsoever. Very very happy.

However, one big issue is that the ends of the arms will scratch the inside of the lenses when the glasses are folded and stored inside their provided case. This scratching is enough to be noticeable while wearing the glasses. This is frustrating. I feel that I will have to 1. replace the lens and 2. add protective silicone tips to the ends of the arms. I don’t feel that this is something I should have to do for glasses this expensive.

One other minor complaints include the side shields as others have mentioned. They do not seem to want to be removed; I fear that if I try they will break. So mounted they will remain and that will limit the versatility of these glasses.

Aside from those two issues, these remain excellent glasses that I am happy to own and would recommend to anyone.
review.name: Almost perfect but some aggrivating issues persist

review.reviewBody: The photochromic lens with chromapop is amazing, the VLT range is superb and combined with a perfect field of view and lightweight frame I forget I'm wearing them
review.name: Exceeded expectations

review.reviewBody: Great all around glasses. So far have used for MTB (moderate fall temps), 1 early season light ski tour and lot's of Resort skiing. Great coverage and they fit my expansive head well :) . Little fogging , so far only when stopping after high exertion skiing in cold temps. Very little wind bleed at high speeds. Not the perfection solution for flat light but what is ? My Oakley Sutros i with the snow prism lense are marginally better in flat light but more wind bleed and too light of a tint when the sun comes out. Love that the photochromatic lense covers my need for darker lenses as it gets brighter ( bright light fatigues my sensitive eyes). There are a couple of design flaws- super hard to remove side shields, I just leave them on, and plastic temple ends scratch the inside of the lens when folded in the case ( they need soft rubber pad on the ends, put a chums or other retainer on immediately).
review.name: Best I've found yet !

review.reviewBody: Already broke.....
review.name: Broken hinge, one month in

review.reviewBody: Excellent fit and finish. Blocks out almost all of the glare that usually comes in through the sides.
review.name: Buy a pair, you won't regret it.

review.reviewBody: Awesome fit and design. Unfortunately my nose pad already stopped functioning properly in just 3 days of use. Under engineered component for sure. Kinda sad.
review.name: Greatish

name: Pursuit ChromaPop Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: Love these, great fit with the adjustable nose piece. Integrate well with my bike helmet. The lens does an amazing job on bright sunny days and believe it or not cloudier low light conditions as well. Comes with a clear lens but even on some stormy days haven’t had to use it. Really like now the frame protrudes around the lens so if you drop them lens down, they hit the frame and not your lenses! Great design all the way around.

review.reviewBody: Excellent on all accounts and the ability to easily change lenses for light conditions is a game changer. The look is modern, the fit is comfortable with adjustment options, and the field of vision is top of its class.
review.name: Excellent on all levels

review.reviewBody: The photos look like it comes with a spare clear lens, but it does not specify in the description. Does anyone know?
review.name: Do these comes with a spare clear lens?

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite III Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This works as a base layer or an outer layer, warm, comfort and looks great. Stands up to machine washing, much easier than i expected to hand wash. Airdried quickly, no wrinkles snags or pills. The fit selector was spot on. Wore for a week solid through a power outage and looked fresh at the end.
review.name: Absolutely love it

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite III Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: I loved the purple "Magic" color but the new neckline is way too high. It's uncomfortable and rubs against the neck in an irritating way. I had to return it. I hope they return to the previous version neck line or offer a scoop or V-neck.
review.name: New neckline too high

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite III Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like this shirt. IB makes good quality 100% merino shirts.
review.name: Cool design and good quality of merino fabric

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite III Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are great shirts. Unlike some of the base layer shirts, I can wear these as EITHER a base layer OR as a normal tee - they are thick enough not to show off what's underneath. Time will tell if they are as durable as a thicker fabric.
review.name: Light, comfortable, good-looking.

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite III Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I discovered merino wool clothing this past spring. I have slowly been trying products from different companies. This t-shirt is far superior to any other that I have tried. I love it and have worn it every day since receiving it. It has all the benefits of merino wool like never smelly and needing washed less often than cotton or synthetic. While none of my merino wool clothing has been itchy, this shirt just has an extra smooth feel against my skin that I adore.
review.name: My new favorite shirt!

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite III Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits great, true to size, seems to be durable although I'd only worn it a few times.
review.name: Love it

review.itemreviewed: Merino 150 Tech Lite III Short-Sleeve T-Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable and true to size! I'll be buying more Icebreaker merino wool!
review.name: Perfect layer for our recent trip to the Pyrenees!

hasVariant.name: Blitz 30L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Blitz 30L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Blitz 30L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Blitz 30L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought the black model and I've been happy with it.  Excellent yoke, great size to the water bottle pockets, ABC set-up is great.  Very comfortable pack to wear around town.  I have not taken it to the trails yet, but the waist strap is not spectacular, so I expect that I'll need to consider the weight of the pack a bit more carefully than I normally would.

I like the size of the pack but I feel it could benefit from an extra inch of width for the sake of getting a 15" laptop in there more comfortably.  Mine fits but you definitely notice the difference in width with the pack full. 32 litres would be about perfect for this pack in my opinion.
I am just over 6 feet and about 220lbs with fairly wide shoulders.  I bought the S/M size, which I am at the upper end of, but the large is too big for me.

Full U-shape opening is excellent, makes organization and access easy.  I mostly use it as a top hatch opening in day to day use, but when I travel further from home I enjoy the full opening.  The zippers are a touch on the stiff side and the grab handle is literally just a piece of webbing, so smoother zippers and a bit of a beefier handle would go a long way for me, but I am knit-picking.

Favourite things: Full clam opening, sturdy construction, ABC access, and side opening for laptop (has top access from inside as well).  Very comfortable shoulder straps.

Possible improvements:  Smoother zippers, beefier grab handle, removable padded waist straps, slightly wider profile.  My personal preference would be to have the laptop side access completely separate from the main panel opening of the pack as well.  A place to tuck away the straps when they are not in use would also be a valuable addition.

This bag is exceptional in terms of its ability to cover a wide variety of activities.  I like it mostly for EDC around town, but with the right waist straps I see no reason why it couldn't rock the trail as well.  And for short hikes the regular webbing probably can manage just fine.

Best pack I've owned by a long way, so I am looking forward to putting it through the wringer.  As a final note, a lot of reviews dislike the tactical look to the bag, but in the black I don't find it sticks out so badly.  I am unlikely to use the molle attachments on the exterior as I think it gets a but chunky-looking once pouches are added, but to each their own I suppose.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: Probably one of my favorite EDC packs of all times.
review.name: Blitz 30

review.reviewBody: Bought the blitz 30 pack for quick response on SAR and recreationally adventures. Just after I set it up had the opportunity to test it out on an injured hunter in back country. Game changer in all my gear fits and comfortable for long hikes and form fitting to body. It will replace all the day packs that I have.
review.name: Great packs and gear bags.

review.reviewBody: Previous experience with MR Fireline packs brought me here to the Blitz Series.  Mostly I use the pack as a junk hauler,  everything from shower towels and phone gadgets to small tools and “EDC” stuff.  The easy access laptop slot works wonders for an iPad.  I love the exterior pockets for pens pencils and notebooks, etc.  Whatever doesn’t fit can be strapped up with the Molle straps or any of the miscellaneous straps on the outside.  Extremely versatile.  Comfortable and adjustable with the same yoke system in many of their packs.  Downside, like most MR stuff, this pack is pricey.
review.name: Big upgrade from a traditional pack

review.reviewBody: Comfortable bag, nice features only complaint is no water port.
review.name: Great backpack.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this bag about a month ago. The materials are great, the constructability is exactly what I was looking for, and it should last a long time. The biggest issue is the size of the main compartment. I wish you had a 35L, but without the "pouch" or "cinched roll-up" currently on the 35L Blitz. The design of the zippers on the 30L Blitz is awesome. Have you considered making a replica of the 30L in a larger size? 

I would recommend a Mystery Ranch bag for its construction and materials, and the fact that you will repair the bags. I would just be honest with them about the size of this particular bag.
review.name: Good but not great

review.reviewBody:
I've had many other good packs over the years working as a network engineer that has to bring a plethora of tools with me through TSA, going site to site, and I spend quite a bit of time with a pack on my back as a result. Every other pack either fails at the stitching, or hurts my back or upper back/neck. The Blitz 30 just works for me, and conforms to my back enough to where I don't have any pain in my upper/lower back. I am 5'10", and ordered the small/medium. I was able to custom size the back panel very easily to fit me perfectly. What an awesome system!

On it's own without accessories, the Blitz 30 holds everything better than similarly sized packs around the 30L size, which is the limit I'm willing to stuff underneath a plane seat. I purchased a few of the small mystery ranch simple gear pouches in different colors so that I know what is what, and I stuff those into the internal vertical side pouches, and I have a soft-sided specialty tool bag for my network tools as well as the small mystery ranch padded power/cord pouch (mission control) that both fit perfectly into the bottom middle portion of the bag, which leaves a ton of room in the middle of my pack to hold things like a tablet and steamdeck.

This pack holds 4x of the small void bags, and 1-2 small mission control bags with relative ease in the main compartment, with a ton of room left over if needed. I also put my firearm in that middle space in it's holster when not travelling via plane when transporting off-person. I also purchased a pack of web keepers to tidy up the additional hanging webbing, so don't forget those.

The laptop pouch holds my Dell Latitude 5430 Rugged laptop, but the side zipper on the back portion does not work so well for my laptop due to it's thickness. However, that is not so much a concern for me, because I can just open the zipper below the admin pouch anyway to grab it which is another great feature. If your laptop is less thick than say my laptop or something like a Panasonic Toughbook, you will not have that problem. Basically any laptop thicker than 3/4" might give you issues when trying to pull it out of that side access zipper. Speaking of which - The admin pouch is huge, and very usable!

The fit, finish, stitching, zippers and overall construction of the pack is second to none. I was highly impressed with the materials they used to construct this pack, and even the small pouches I purchased. This brand is expensive, but I believe it is very much worth the money so long as you use it daily, which I do. I consider this pack to be one of the best purchases I've ever made. Thank you, Mystery Ranch!
review.name: Awesome pack for engineers on the go!

review.reviewBody:
I’m a member of the RCMP and wanted a bag to carry medical supplies.  I found myself the other day running through a field with tourniquets in one hand, and a trauma kit in the other, trying to locate a plane crash.  I could only carry so much.  This bag lets me carry everything I need, and organize it in a way that makes sense.  The quick access to the main compartment is also why I bought it; I love the fact I can zip open the entire bag quickly to get at anything I need.  The molle also allows me to tie the trauma kit and tourniquets directly to the bag.  

I also noticed that the Emergency Response Team medics use the 2-day Assault bag for their medical supplies; I expect the Blitz 30 bag wasn’t available yet at that time.
review.name: Medical bag

review.reviewBody: Have used it for a week so far and love it. Would highly recommend this to anyone.
review.name: Very comfortable to where

review.reviewBody: This pack is what you would expect from Mystery Ranch! Very high quality. The only complaint I have is the laptop pouch tends to lean into the main compartment when top loading. I spent a couple of bucks on some double sided Velcro for strap management.
review.name: Great pack

name: Blitz 30L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I’m wearing this parka for over a month now daily and I can say it is the best parka I ever had. It is very warm, waterproof enough, lightweight and looks great.
review.name: So far the best

review.reviewBody: Boxy, uncomfortable material, no stretch. Hood is weird and has flaps that won’t snap to the jacket, aside from the back area so it’s all up in your face.  The color is NOT a smolder blue. It’s navy blue. Outer material feels crunchy and just ugly in general
review.name: Ugly

review.reviewBody: I really love this jacket and want to keep it but the sleeves are a tad short and chaff my writs. The way it's gathered saws the bone. Never had that before. There is no interior cuff or lining  and the rough outer material is very stiff. I'm 5'8" slender with longer arms. If the sleeves hit a little lower it might not be as bothersome. Or, if I always wear gloves or longer sleeves it could work. It's kinda big and I ordered a medium, so I don't want to size up. Requires too many particulars to be comfy. Had to return. Bummer.
review.name: Great But Sleeves Chaff

review.reviewBody: Perfect for cold New England winters. I wish it were more adjustable but it’s so warm, fits true to size, and looks great.
review.name: Lightweight but really warm

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam Hierro v7 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I'm a tour guide, I walk 26k steps a day, 5 days a week. 
Not only that, I'm 56 years old, had a hip replacement and quite wide feet.And I live in Scotland, loads of rain..
These shoes so far have been the best.
I've had previous versions,  these are great though got regular as well as the GTX version for when it rains..
review.name: Best I've had

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam Hierro v7 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great trainers, super comfy, great support and cushioning really happy with them.
review.name: Awesome trainers

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam Hierro v7 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Ridiculously comfy shoes. Really good fit. Outstanding grip levels on and off road. The laces are a bit too bright for my liking and I will swap out for something more subtle. Otherwise, another excellent set of New Balance shoes.
review.name: Ridiculously comfy shoes

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam Hierro v7 Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Quite disappointed with the cushion provided. Finding them to be very firm unlike previous versions I have had.
review.name: Not as good as previous versions
comment: We are grateful for your feedback, our apologies for the inconvenience. Comfort is of utmost importance to us, and we are dedicated to ensuring that you find a shoe that not only meets your style preferences but also provides the utmost comfort. Please feel free to share any specific requirements or concerns with our team.

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam Hierro v7 Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Excellent pair of shoes, high quality, sems sturdy and the colour it is on trend now. The only thing is that you definitely have to choose by width. For me as a wider foot the standard width was too narrow.

review.reviewBody: I've been using North Face tents for over 30 years. After you've been through a Himalayan, Denali, Antarctic storms in this tent, I know when I arrive at base camp and see this tent I breath a sigh of relief.
review.name: Expedition Perfection!!!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Easy to set up, bug flor area to support 5-ppl family
review.name: Simple Beautiful with great design details

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Simple, beautiful with great design details. Al little bit expensive but very worthy
review.name: Simple, beautiful with great design details

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Brilliant
review.name: Great tent. I Was very Happy with it in Alaska.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was out in the harsh wilderness by me and got attacked by a Turkey I ran into the tent and the Turkey tried too attack the tent he didn't get far before he fleed the sence the text is still in amazing condition and would buy one again
review.name: BEST TENT EVER

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Russian Bear tents are also 50 pounds but include a stove and can keep the interior at 80°F at -80°F outside. If stoves are not possible, then this option is sufficient as long as you have a top notch pad and bag. Used in Red Lake, Ontario, Canada and International Falls -40F. Wind was bad. This tent did not budge. Setup was fairly easy the firat time.
review.name: Better options but ok

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If it's cold outside. Why don't you come into this warm oasis in the snow. Heat up that tookus and toast the buns.
review.name: This tent will warm you buns

review.reviewBody: Headed to Park city, these things fit me perfect. I need a tall and these do it.

review.reviewBody: Love these! The short length was great on my 5'2" frame. Nice and warm even without a base layer. Vents in inner thigh. High waisted and the waist is adjustable with stretchy bands that Velcro in a looser or tighter position. Wore them for 2 weeks in Norway and Iceland.
review.name: I'm 5'2" and thick - these were great!!

review.reviewBody: First pair of North Face ski pants. Fit well, good quality
review.name: Yup. They are pants.

review.reviewBody: I cannot wait to wear my pants this winter It fit me right!!!! I am 4.11 and I went short perfect Thank you to my favorite brand

review.reviewBody: I used these pants for a trip to Iceland. They are great! It is waterproof and windproof with extra room to layer up. I love that it has an adjustable waistband.
review.name: Great for active adventures.

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality pants and will be warm when worn in the winter. Love the color. Sizing is accurate.

review.reviewBody: Now 5'3, 150lbs, size M (40lbs lighter). Still think pants are made for hour glass figure w/ no junk in trunk. If you carry weight in your belly or have large booty these probably aren't for you.

While I didn't pick these up from Backcountry, I did grab them from a local shop in ABQ. I normally used Vans BMX and throught they were pretty nice on flats.  The amount of support and how well they stick to the Oneups blows the Vans away.

I've been trying to geta buddy on board with them since he rides with some low Patagonia hikers.

I plan on buying another bag for winter, but this perfect for fall and spring. The overall quality of the bag is really nice and comfortable.
review.name: Not a winter bag

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I just did a winter overnight backpacking excursion and it kept me plenty warm. I especially like the hood on the bag for extra warmth. Would buy again!
review.name: Great bag for the price and lightweight

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: I ordered this for my husband, who wanted more room in his sleeping bag. He planned to ditch a mummy bag to accomplish that, but he absolutely loves this one. He has plenty of room to turn over without taking the whole sleeping bag with him.
review.name: Comfortable and roomy bag

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have spent almost a dozen nights in my 20-degree Trestles and I think it's great, especially when nights are in the 55 to 35-degree range. I have used it backpacking, rafting and car camping. There is plenty of hip and torso room, the zipper system is great, it's plenty roomy for me: I'm 5-10 & 165. It becomes a warm mummy and I'm confident with long underwear and a hat it's warm below freezing. The bag stuffs very small for a synthetic bag but retains loft well. I have one fancier $$ down bag that is better, but the Trestles is the best value. It blows away all my synthetic North Face bags from the 90s & 00s.
review.name: Excellent all-around bag for temps above freezing

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is incredible. I haven't been completely enclosed in a sleeping bag since I was maybe 15 years old. At 6'6"/240lbs, with size 15 feet, at least some part of my body was going to be wedged against something. Not here! The generous footwell is a game changer -- my feet stick straight up with zero pressure from any side. My entire body fits in the bag, completely zipped, with inches to spare. All that, and the bag still stuffs into a ball smaller than my head (and I mean stuffs! No folding or gentleness required, you can just mash it into the stuff sack). Throw in the fact that it is generously warm while staying so light, and this is my go-to pack year-round in the Cascades. Cannot recommend enough!
review.name: I am a warm, happy giant

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have used this a lot, and I am a cold sleeper! Even in Florida, I use this bag, and I TRUST it to keep me warm. I hate being chilled in the night!
review.name: BEST BAG EVER!

name: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic

review.reviewBody:
I like this style helmet that covers your ears.  I have a UVEX and Gyro in same style but the Dropframe is much better looking, so I had high hopes.

The BOA system is good but the implementation is bad, its difficult to crank down as the strings bind and then there is a very tight pressure in a small footprint placed on your forehead from the string system.    

Ill still run this but not for long days on the bike...
review.name: Great looking lid, super uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: I've used Garneau bibs exclusively for over a decade. All of their new products are absolute garbage quality compared to products just a couple years ago. These bibs have an annoying silicone gripper around the leg, unlike the nice powerbands from years past.  The material is so thin its virtually see through and not supportive at all. You couldn't pay me to wear these! What happened to Louis Garneau?
review.name: Absolute garbage quality

review.reviewBody: I loved the Fit Sensor 2 Bib Shorts and after 6 years of wear, looked forward to replacing my old ones with the new Fit Sensor 3 Bib Shorts. Rather than an improvement on a great product, however, this new version is a step backwards. The material is much thinner, the waist is much looser, the straps are thinner, and the overall fit and quality are inferior to the previous version of these bib shorts. While I am generally a fan of LG cycling gear, I would not recommend this product.
review.name: A Step Backwards
comment: Yep. Agree on all counts. And, silicon leg grippers - yuk.
Thanks for the review.  I also have the Fit Sensor 2 Bib shorts which I bought in 2016 and was looking to replace.  Your review answered my questions about the Sensor 3 build quality.

name: Fit Sensor 3 Bib Short - Men's

description: Buy the 7 Protection Sam Hill Knee Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sam Hill Knee Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the 7 Protection Sam Hill Knee Pad online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great pad, super comfortable and creates great.  Only better pad out there is the Rapha, which has a thicker top band and thicker material at the back.  I wanted the thicker material since I've had the mesh on other pads rip easily with my flat pedal pins.  Otherwise, darn close to perfect.  You forget they are there.
review.name: Excellent pad, excellent coverage

review.reviewBody:
I'm a petite lady and these pads are the first that don't feel overly bulky at the knee, but still feel like they provide good protection! And surprisingly, the shin protection style isn't too long for a shorty (5'3").

Initially the pad inserts felt too wide for the sleeves --- they curved inward and dug into the sides of my knees. BUT after massaging the pads into place and wearing them for a few rides, things fell into place and they're now pretty comfortable (well... as comfortable as knee pads can be). The pad opening placement at the knee was also bothersome at first, but that issue also went away after a few rides.
review.name: great after a brief break-in period

review.reviewBody: On my 3rd set of new kneepads and finally found some that do not dig into my legs and can wear them all day. They also somehow stay up on the thigh as well. Very pleased
review.name: Finally found comfort

review.reviewBody:
These Pads are Super Comfortable for all day Pedaling!!  They are Light weight  yet provide great protection so I wear mine as part of my daily MTB kit for just about all rides. 
I was gonna get the transition but went for the Sam hill since they had the extra side protection. (For Elbows I've been using the Transitions but just bought some lighter Sam Hills)

I've used these Sam Hill Knee pads for 3 plus hr XC Rides, Hot mid Summer Rides,  Shuttle laps, Enduro rides as well as chilly Fall days with no issues. 
Yeah they can get warm on 90+ days but they aren't that bad with that light mesh backing that doesn't bunch up behind your knees while pedaling and I'd rather have protection for certain rides so I can push it. 

Super Durable & Long lasting, They are easy to wash!!  After 3+ seasons, I finally decided to buy a second pair just the other day!
review.name: Awesome and comfy for long rides!!

review.reviewBody:
After just one ride, these pads are already badly torn up. Yes, they are cooler than most other pads, but they can’t stand up to the teeth in your pedals, tree branches, or anything else that you’d routinely hit when riding. 
I’m shocked that an expensive pair of pads like this are made without any regard for durability whatsoever. Meanwhile the POC’s I bought as well are holding up great, have no signs of wear, and are only a tiny bit hotter. I’d recommend those instead.
review.name: Comfort at the cost of durability

review.reviewBody:
I originally bought these in medium. My thigh measured between 18.5? and 18.75? and the mediums were recommended for up to 19?. I wore them around the house when they arrived but I couldn?t tolerate wearing them longer than 15 minutes, let alone going on a multi-hour bike ride in them. Almost felt like I was wearing a tourniquet! Luckily, they fit my wife pretty well and I ordered them again in large. This time they were bang-on as far as sizing. 

I wore them on a two hour ride yesterday and they were so comfortable. Temps were in the 50?s here in NorCal so the added warmth wasn?t too noticeable. No crashes yet, but they seem to provide good protection (better than no knee pads anyways). These are my first set of knee pads and I definitely felt more confident wearing them.
review.name: Perfect After Sizing Up

review.reviewBody:
So far, I love these pads, for two reasons. 1. They are longer overall, so the protection portion covers more of my shin. The sleeve portion above the knee does sit high, but I believe it wouldn't be as effective at staying on without that kind of length.
2. They are sooo comfortable. I find myself wearing them all day without even noticing they're on. While pedaling, I don't notice them and they don't move around or slide up or fall down.
I'm seeing some comments about them being less malleable in colder temperatures. It would make sense, given that the SAS Tech is a malleable material itself, but I've ridden mine all day in temperatures peaking at 50° F or for shorter evening rides between 30° and 45° often and had no comfort issues.
For sizing, I feel like they fit true to size. 
Note: I do have to wear these underneath my riding leggings directly on my skin, otherwise the silicone tape on the sleeve ends don't work and the top slides down.
I will say that I haven't crash-tested these other than getting hit hard in the shin by my pedal once and didnt feel it, but I feel they are a good medium-weight, medium-intensity knee pad. For those wanting hard, heavy-duty protection, you should look at heavier-duty pads.
review.name: Comfy, lightweight pads for mid-level

review.reviewBody:
I know these pads get glowing reviews, which is why I bought them. But I returned them right after trying them on, I could tell they wouldn't work for me for a few reasons:

- The SAS Tech pad is removeable, but the break in the material to remove them is right on the knee cap. So when I flex my knee I can feel the material parting and my knee touching the bare pad. The material has a seam and this seam rubs back and forth on my kneecap every time I flex my knee. I don't see how this wouldn't wear a hole in my skin. I have other knees guards where the material parts near the bottom in order to remove the pad, this seems like a far better solution. 

- The SAS Tech pad is MUCH stiffer vs D30. If it's cold it feels like hard plastic and I'd guess it could be brittle, if this pad cracks you may be left with diminished protection. 

- The padding around the SAS Tech pad is too soft, and there is a gap in between the SAS Tech and the padding sewn in. I can't see the value in this extra padding besides adding bulk and making the pad less comfortable. The thought this extra padding will do anything is wishful thinking imo. 

These pads seem to work well for many folks, but I also think some newer designs/materials might be superior at this point. 

Sizing was good, I ordered XL according to my measurements and they fit well.
review.name: Some Major Flaws

review.reviewBody: They are very protective and very light to carry and aren't as bulcky as the fox ones. They do not move around
review.name: Best knee pads for anyone

review.reviewBody: A previous review described it as mid weight and I would say that's correct. I bought them from a friend's recommendation, and didn't realize that there's no hard plastic in the protection. I think it's just a very dense foam. That's probably ok, but the description says that the, The pad sits higher on the thigh than most pads of similar design." The pad doesn't sit higher, I would actually say that the pad actually extends lower down the shin than most But the retention sleeve does actually sit quite a bit higher on the thigh. I'm just a little bummed because the pad seems to protect very well for a kneeling impact, but if you were to hit just above the knee in a superman style fall, you are def going to feel it. There is some foam in the correct position for this type of impact, but it's very low density and there's a seam that would allow a hit directly through as well.
review.name: Ok Mid Weight

name: Sam Hill Knee Pad

description: Buy the Reima Tirro Jacket - Kids' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tirro Jacket - Kids'
hasVariant.description: Buy the Reima Tirro Jacket - Kids' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Awesome jacket, survived a winter with ease. Never wet inside, always warm (proper laying). I would (will) definitely by again to upsize. Opportunities for improvement: neck circumference is too small to be functional. Pit zips are so small as to be useless (save the cost and complexity. Hood does not fit over a helmet well (every kid should wear a helmet skiing). The front zipper is stiff for a little kid, the 'big tooth' zippers are much easier.
review.name: Great jacket, highly recommended

review.reviewBody: my son loves this jacket. He's a 10 yo slim, well built and it fits him very nice
review.name: fit

review.reviewBody: First time trying reima. For the price I was expecting higher quality - Velcro all over the jacket instead of higher quality pulls, inner lining cheap fabric, amount of filling felt extremely minimal. That said, my son really liked the style and color. I returned it though because I could get past the low quality of construction.
review.name: Like the style, quality feels cheap

name: Tirro Jacket - Kids'

description: Buy the Eureka! SPRK Camp Grill online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: SPRK Camp Grill
hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! SPRK Camp Grill online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: this is a great Grill for car camping setup not looking to lug a bunch of propane. clean up is easy ignition is great we should put out a tiny bit more heat, but this thing is a go-to!
review.name: great grill

review.reviewBody: Works well for a small unit. Perfect for camping. I wish the temperature dial provided some sense of temperature like Fahrenheit or Celsius. I know it can change due to wind, but users should know that. Most often when cooking there is little wind.  Would be GREAT if it included a lid or a lid could be purchased aftermarket for retaining heat when cooking.
review.name: Small but mighty (small quibbles)

review.reviewBody: Went camping with this stove, it was so easy to set up and use.  It cooked a steak to perfection and was easy to clean.  The picnic table was leaning and was able to adjust the stove to cook flat with the adjustable feet.
Pack nice and cooks really well for the camping we did
review.name: Camp grill

review.reviewBody: I love my new grill. It heats up fast and sears meats very nicely. Remember because it's butane it won't have any grilled flavor to speak of. It's great for camping or a tailgate picnic. Cleanup is fairly easy. I have to remember to go easy on the cooking surface when cleaning it. I'm curious how long the coating will last. I can't wait to take it camping.
review.name: Fast and easy camp cooking!

review.reviewBody: Burgers, dogs, salmon Pattie’s tortillas! all cook grate on these. Easy to clean what more do you need.
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: Great, super portable grill. No need to both packing extra pans. If the only thing on the menu for this trip is grillable, you've got what you need. This is not going to boil water in record time (or at all?) but that's not what is was made for. Cleans up quick. I love it whether I'm in the backyard or at camp.
review.name: Sweet Specialty Grill

review.reviewBody: Wow! This thing is not easy to clean specially when you’re at camping. You will be wasting water, time and soap on this one
review.name: Cleaning sucks
comment: Thank you for taking the time to leave your review. We appreciate your feedback and would like to speak with you to further regarding the trouble that you are having cleaning your grill. If you could please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday, we would be happy to hear from you!

review.reviewBody: We used this grill for the first 6 or 7 trips of 2021 thinking it was a much better alternative than a smelly grease covered Portable BBQ.  We've since purchased a green grill pan to use on our one burner Eureka.  Why?  Cleaning this little grill is a chore in camp and I'm a person that cleans it every time since we camp in bear areas.  Food sticks to the grill top even if you give it a quick coat of olive oil before cooking.  The food juices drip down into the grill and coat all the surfaces. Since there is no lid splatters go everywhere.  So now it takes washing every surface of the stove meaning you are wasting water and chill time after each use.  A green grill pan can be cleaned up with a reusable bamboo cloth and you are quickly on to post meal conversations.
review.name: Not that easy to clean

review.reviewBody:
This little grill was thoughtfully designed, and the carrying case is very convenient.

The problem is the cook surface is made from aluminum and a spray on ceramic. (May contain lead, and aluminum is a nuero-toxin)

Cooking on two surfaces that are known toxins is just a bad idea, if this had a cast iron grill top I would pay double for this item.
review.name: Great design, with exception of cooking surface...

name: SPRK Camp Grill
